translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We had earlier given Abraham true direction, for We knew him well.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed We bestowed Ibrahim with guidance from the beginning, and We were Aware of him.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We gave Abraham aforetime his rectitude -- for We knew him --

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed un to lbrahim his rectitude aforetime, and him We had ever known.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We bestowed aforetime on Ibrahim (Abraham) his (portion of) guidance, and We were Well-Acquainted with him (as to his Belief in the Oneness of Allah, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Abraham his integrity formerly, and We knew him well.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely We had bestowed wisdom upon Abraham even earlier, and We knew him well.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We bestowed aforetime on Ibrahim his guidance, and We were Well-Acquainted with him.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Abraham of old his proper course, and We were Aware of him,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We had given Abraham his probity before, and We knew him

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Before this We gave Abraham his virtue, for We knew him.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To Abraham We gave the right guidance and We knew him very well.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave to Ibrahim his rectitude before, and We knew him fully well.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Before this We gave Abraham his guidance. We knew him well.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct, and well were We acquainted with him.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these idols to which you cling so passionately?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: when he said to his father and his people, 'What are these statues unto which you are cleaving?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Recall what time he said unto his father and his people what are these images to which ye are cleaving?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these images, to which you are devoted?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people, “What are these statues to which you are devoted?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Recall, when he said to his father and his people: "What are these images to which you are devoutly clinging?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these images to which you are devoted"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When he said unto his father and his folk: What are these images unto which ye pay devotion?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: when he said to his father and his people, ‘What are these images to which you keep on clinging?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said to his father and to his nation: 'What, are these the statues to which you cling'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham asked his father and his people, "What are these statues which you worship?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: What are these images to whose worship you cleave?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When he asked his father and his people, "What are these images to which you are so devoted?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! he said to his father and his people, "What are these images, to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They replied: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “We found our forefathers worshipping them.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'We found our fathers serving them.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: we found our fathers the worshippers thereof.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said:"We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “We found our parents worshiping them.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They answered: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: We found our fathers worshippers of them.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘We found our fathers worshipping them.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They replied: 'We found our fathers worshipping them'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They replied, "We found our fathers worshipping them".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: We found our fathers worshipping them.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo wajadna abaana laha AAabideena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They replied, "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "You and your fathers were in clear error."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Then assuredly you and your fathers have been in manifest error.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: assuredlY ye, ye and your fathers, have been in error manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He said: "Indeed you and your fathers have been in manifest error."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “You and your parents are in evident error.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He said: "Certainly you and your fathers have all been in manifest error."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Indeed you and your fathers have been in manifest error."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Verily ye and your fathers were in plain error.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Certainly you and your fathers have been in manifest error.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'Truly, you and your fathers are in clear error'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "Both you and your fathers have certainly been in error."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Certainly you have been, (both) you and your fathers, in manifest error.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham said, "Indeed, you and your fathers have been clearly misguided."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said, "Indeed ye have been in manifest error - ye and your fathers."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "Are you speaking in earnest, or only jesting?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Have you brought the Truth to us, or are you just making fun?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'What, hast thou come to us with the truth, or art thou one of those that play?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: hast thou come unto us with the truth, or art thou of those who sport?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Have you brought us the truth, or are you one of those who play about?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Are you telling us the truth, or are you just playing?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: "Are you expressing your true ideas before us or are you jesting?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you one of those who play about"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Bringest thou unto us the truth, or art thou some jester?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Are you telling the truth, or are you [just] kidding?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'Is it the truth you have brought us, or are you one of those that play'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They exclaimed, "Have you brought the Truth or are you joking?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Have you brought to us the truth, or are you one of the triflers?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo ajitana bialhaqqi am anta mina allaAAibeena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Have you brought us the truth or are you jesting?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you one of those who jest?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "In fact it was your Lord, the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who created them; and I bear witness to this.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who originated them, and I am one of those that bear witness thereunto.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: Aye! your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth Who created them, and as to that I am of the witnesses.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He said: "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them and of that I am one of the witnesses.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the One who created them, and I bear witness to that.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He said: "Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth which He created and to that I bear witness before you.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them and to that I am one of the witnesses."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them; and I am of those who testify unto that.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Indeed, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who originated them, and I affirm that.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'No' he answered, 'your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Originator of them, and I am among those bearing witness to it.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. It was He who created them and I testify to this fact".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Nay! your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who brought them into existence, and I am of those who bear witness to this:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham replied, "Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who created them, and I bear witness to that.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: I swear by God I will do something to your idols when you have turned your backs and gone."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And, by God, I shall assuredly outwit your idols, after you have gone away turning your backs.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And by Allah I shall surely devise a plot against your idols after ye turned away backward.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And by Allah, I shall plot a plan (to destroy) your idols after you have gone away and turned your backs."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “By God, I will have a plan for your statues after you have gone away.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: By Allah, I shall certainly carry out my plan against your gods after you are gone."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And by Allah, I shall plot a plan for your idols after you have gone away and turned your backs."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And, by Allah, I shall circumvent your idols after ye have gone away and turned your backs.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: By Allah, I will devise a stratagem against your idols after you have gone away.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: By Allah, I will certainly outwit your idols as soon as you have turned your backs and gone'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [I swear] by Allah, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham said to himself, "By God! I will devise a plan against their idols when they are away."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And, by Allah! I will certainly do something against your idols after you go away, turning back.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: By the Lord, I will devise a plan against your deities after you have gone away and turned your backs!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "And by Allah, I have a plan for your idols - after ye go away and turn your backs"..

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So he smashed them up to pieces with the exception of the biggest, so that they may turn to it.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He shattered them all, except the biggest among them, that perhaps they may question it.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So he broke them into fragments, all but a great one they had, for haply they would return to it.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he made them fragments, all except the big one of them, that haply unto it they may return.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So he broke them to pieces, (all) except the biggest of them, that they might turn to it.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So he reduced them into pieces, except for their biggest, that they may return to it.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then he broke them all into pieces, sparing only the supreme one among them that they may possibly return to him.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So he broke them to pieces, except the biggest of them, that they might turn to it.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then he reduced them to fragments, all save the chief of them, that haply they might have recourse to it.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So he broke them into pieces—all except the biggest of them—so that they might come back to it.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He broke them all into pieces, except their great one so that they might return to it.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He broke all the idols into pieces, except the biggest among them so that perhaps people would refer to it.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So he broke them into pieces, except the chief of them, that haply they may return to it.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: FajaAAalahum juthathan illa kabeeran lahum laAAallahum ilayhi yarjiAAoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He broke them all into pieces, except for the biggest one of them, so that they might return to it [for enquiry].

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So he broke them to pieces, (all) but the biggest of them, that they might turn (and address themselves) to it.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They asked (on return): "Who has done this to our gods? He is surely a mischief-monger."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Who has done this to our Gods? He is indeed cruel!”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Who has. done this with our gods? Surely he is one of the evildoers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: who hath wrought this to our gods? verily he is of the wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Who has done this to our aliha (gods)? He must indeed be one of the wrong-doers."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Who did this to our gods? He is certainly one of the wrongdoers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (When they saw the idols in this state) they said: "Who has done this to our gods? Surely he is one of the wrong-doers."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Who has done this to our gods He must indeed be one of the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Who hath done this to our gods? Surely it must be some evil-doer.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Whoever has done this to Our gods?! He is indeed a wrongdoer!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Who has done this to our gods' they exclaimed. 'He must surely be a harmdoer'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (When the people came to the temple and saw the broken idols) they asked each other, "Who has done this to our gods? He certainly is an unjust person".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Who has done this to our gods? Most surely he is one of the unjust.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo man faAAala hatha bialihatina innahu lamina alththalimeena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "Who has done this to our deities? He must be a wrongdoer."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some man of impiety!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "We heard a youth talk about them. He is called Abraham."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Some among them said, “We heard a youth speak ill of them – the one called Ibrahim.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'We heard a young man making mention of them, and he was called Abraham.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: We heard a youth speak of them, who is called Ibrahim.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "We heard a young man talking (against) them who is called Ibrahim (Abraham)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “We heard a youth mentioning them. He is called Abraham.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Some of them said: "We heard a youth called Abraham speak (ill) of them."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "We heard a young man talking against them, who is called Ibrahim."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: We heard a youth make mention of them, who is called Abraham.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘We heard a young man mentioning them. He is called ‘‘Abraham.’’ ’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'We have heard a young man called Abraham mention them' they replied.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Some of them said, "We heard a youth called Abraham speaking against the idols".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: We heard a youth called Ibrahim speak of them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Some said, "We heard a young man, called Abraham, talking about them."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "We heard a youth talk of them: He is called Abraham."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Bring him before the people," they said, "that they may bear witness."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Therefore bring him in front of the people, perhaps they may testify.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Bring him before the people's eyes; haply they shall bear witness.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: bring him then before the eyes of the people, haply they may bear witness.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The others said: "Bring him, then, before the eyes of the people that they may see (what will be done to him)."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes that they may testify.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Bring him before the people’s eyes so that they may bear witness [against him].’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'Then bring him here so that the people may see, so that they may bear witness'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Their chiefs said, "Bring him before the eyes of the people and let them testify that he has spoken against the idols."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Said they: Then bring him before the eyes of the people, perhaps they may bear witness.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo fatoo bihi AAala aAAyuni alnnasi laAAallahum yashhadoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Then bring him here in the sight of all the people, so that they may act as witnesses."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Did you do this to our gods, O Abraham?" they enquired.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Did you do this to our Gods, O Ibrahim?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'So, art thou the man who did this unto our gods, Abraham?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: art thou the one who hath wrought this unto our gods, O Ibrahim?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Are you the one who has done this to our gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Are you the one who did this to our gods, O Abraham?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (On Abraham's arrival) they said: "Abraham, are you he who has done this to our gods?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Are you the one who has done this to our gods, O Ibrahim"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Is it thou who hast done this to our gods, O Abraham?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Was it you who did this to our gods, O Abraham?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Abraham' they said, 'was it you who did this to our gods'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They asked, "Abraham, did you do this to our idols?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Have you done this to our gods, O Ibrahim?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Abraham, was it you who did this to our deities?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Art thou the one that did this with our gods, O Abraham?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "No," he said. "It was done by that chief of theirs. Ask him in case they can speak."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'No; it was this great one of them that did it. Question them; if they are able to speak!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: rather he hath wrought it: this big one of them: so question them, if they ever speak.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Nay, this one, the biggest of them (idols) did it. Ask them, if they can speak!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “But it was this biggest of them that did it. Ask them, if they can speak.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He answered: "Rather it was this supreme one who has done it. So ask them, if they can speak."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Nay, this one, the biggest of them did it. Ask them, if they can speak!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: But this, their chief hath done it. So question them, if they can speak.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘No, it was this biggest one of them who did it! Ask them, if they can speak.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'No' he replied. 'It was their great one amongst them that did it. Ask them, if they are able to speak'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He replied, "I think the biggest among them has broken the smaller ones. Ask them if they are able to speak".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Surely (some doer) has done it; the chief of them is this, therefore ask them, if they can speak.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He answered, "Rather this biggest one of them did it. Ask them, if they can speak."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Nay, this was done by - this is their biggest one! ask them, if they can speak intelligently!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then they thought and observed: "Surely you are yourselves unjust."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So they turned towards their own selves and (inwardly) said, “Indeed you yourselves are unjust.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So they returned one to another, and they said, 'Surely it is you who are the evildoers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They then turned to themselves, and said: verily ye it is who are the wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So they turned to themselves and said: "Verily, you are the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then they turned to one another, and said, “You yourselves are the wrongdoers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon they turned to their (inner) selves and said (to themselves): "Surely it is you who are the wrong-doers."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So they turned to themselves and said: "Verily, you are the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then gathered they apart and said: Lo! ye yourselves are the wrong-doers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereat they came to themselves and said [to one another], ‘Indeed it is you who are the wrongdoers!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So they returned one to another saying, 'Surely, it is you who are the harmdoers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Thereupon they realized their own foolishness and said, "We ourselves are wrong-doers".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then they turned to themselves and said: Surely you yourselves are the unjust;

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: FarajaAAoo ila anfusihim faqaloo innakum antumu alththalimoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then they turned to one another and said, "It is you yourselves who are in the wrong,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So they turned to themselves and said, "Surely ye are the ones in the wrong!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then crestfallen (they confessed): "Truly, as you know, they cannot speak."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then they were utterly put to confusion saying, 'Very well indeed thou knowest these do not speak.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Thereafter they were made to turn over upon their heads, saying, assuredly thou knowest that they speak not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then they turned to themselves (their first thought and said): "Indeed you [Ibrahim (Abraham)] know well that these (idols) speak not!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But they reverted to their old ideas: “You certainly know that these do not speak.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then their minds were turned upside down, and they said: "You know well that they do not speak."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then they turned to themselves: "Indeed you know well that these speak not!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And they were utterly confounded, and they said: Well thou knowest that these speak not.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then they hung their heads. [However, they said,] ‘You certainly know that they cannot speak.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But then they reversed their minds: 'You know they do not speak'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then they reversed themselves, [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: With their heads cast down they said, "Abraham, you know that idols do not speak. How then can you ask such a question?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then they were made to hang down their heads: Certainly you know that they do not speak.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: then they hung their heads, and said, "O Abraham! You know they cannot speak."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then were they confounded with shame: (they said), "Thou knowest full well that these (idols) do not speak!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (So Abraham) said: "Then why do you worship something apart from God that cannot profit you or do you harm?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'What, and do you serve, apart from God, that which profits you nothing; neither hurts you?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: worship ye, then, beside Allah, that which profiteth you not at all, nor it hurteth you

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Do you then worship besides Allah, things that can neither profit you, nor harm you?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Do you worship, instead of God, what can neither benefit you in anything, nor harm you?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: "Do you, then, worship beside Allah a thing that can neither benefit you nor hurt you?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Do you then worship besides Allah, things that can neither profit you nor harm you"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Worship ye then instead of Allah that which cannot profit you at all, nor harm you?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Then, do you worship besides Allah that which cannot cause you any benefit or harm?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'Would you then worship that, instead of Allah, which can neither help nor harm you?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allah that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "Do you, instead of God, worship things that can neither harm nor benefit you?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: What! do you then serve besides Allah what brings you not any benefit at all, nor does it harm you?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham said, "So, do you worship something instead of God that can neither benefit you nor harm you?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Abraham) said, "Do ye then worship, besides Allah, things that can neither be of any good to you nor do you harm?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Fie on you and those you worship besides God! Will you not understand?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Disgrace be upon you and all the idols whom you worship instead of Allah; so do you not have sense?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Fie upon you and that you serve apart from God! Do you not understand?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Fie upon you and upon that which ye worship beside Allah! Will ye not then reflect?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Fie upon you, and upon that which you worship besides Allah! Have you then no sense?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Fie on you, and on what you worship instead of God. Do you not understand?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Fie upon you and upon all that you worship beside Allah. Do you have no sense?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Fie upon you, and upon that which you worship besides Allah! Have you then no sense"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Fie on you and all that ye worship instead of Allah! Have ye then no sense?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Fie on you and what you worship besides Allah! Do you not exercise your reason?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Shame on you and on that you worship other than Allah! Have you no understanding'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allah. Then will you not use reason?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Woe to you for what you worship instead of God. Have you no understanding?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Fie on you and on what you serve besides Allah; what! do you not then understand?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Offin lakum walima taAAbudoona min dooni Allahi afala taAAqiloona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Shame on you and on whatever you worship instead of God. Can you not understand?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Fie upon you, and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah! Have ye no sense?"..

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember when Abraham said to Azar, his father: "Why do you take idols for God? I certainly find you and your people in error."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember when Ibrahim said to his father (paternal uncle) Azar, “What! You appoint idols as Gods? Indeed I find you and your people in open error.” (Prophet Ibrahim was rightly guided since birth).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Abraham said to his father Azar, 'Takest thou idols for gods? I see thee, and thy people, in manifest error.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Ibrahim said unto his father Azar: takest thou idols for gods! Verily I see thee and thy people in error manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father Azar: "Do you take idols as aliha (gods)? Verily, I see you and your people in manifest error.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Abraham said to his father Azar, “Do you take idols for gods? I see that you and your people are in evident error.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recall when Abraham said to his father, Azar: 'Do you take idols for gods? I see you and your people in obvious error.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim said to his father Azar: "Do you take idols as gods Verily, I see you and your people in manifest error."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Remember) when Abraham said unto his father Azar: Takest thou idols for gods? Lo! I see thee and thy folk in error manifest.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Abraham said to Azar, his father, ‘Do you take idols for gods? Indeed I see you and your people in manifest error.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (And remember) when Abraham said to his father Azar: 'Will you take idols for gods, surely I see you and your people are in clear error'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father Azar, "Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people to be in manifest error."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Consider when Abraham asked his father, Azar, "Why do you believe idols to be your gods? I find you and your people in absolute error".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Ibrahim said to his sire, Azar: Do you take idols for gods? Surely I see you and your people in manifest error.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Remember when Abraham said to his father, Azar, "Do you take idols as your gods? I see that you and your people have clearly gone astray."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Lo! Abraham said to his father Azar: "Takest thou idols for gods? For I see thee and thy people in manifest error."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Thus We showed to Abraham the visible and invisible world of the heavens and the earth, that he could be among those who believe.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And likewise We showed Ibrahim the entire kingdom of the heavens and the earth and so that he be of those who believe as eyewitnesses.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So We were showing Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and earth, that he might be of those having sure faith.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And in this wise We showed unto Ibrahim the governance of the heavens and the earth, and that he might become of the convinced.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Thus did we show Ibrahim (Abraham) the kingdom of the heavens and the earth that he be one of those who have Faith with certainty.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Thus We showed Abraham the empire of the heavens and the earth, that he might be one of those with certainty.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And thus We showed Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, so that he might become one of those who have sure faith.. The adversaries are told that they can observe God's signs in the phenomena of the universe, just as Abraham could. The difference is that they see nothing, as if they were blind, whereas Abraham saw with open eyes. The sun, moon and stars which rise and set before their eyes day after day and night after night witness them as misguided at their setting as at their rising. Yet the same signs were observed by the perceptive Abraham, and the physical phenomena helped him arrive at the Truth.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Thus did we show Ibrahim the kingdom of the heavens and the earth that he be one of those who have faith with certainty.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Thus did We show Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth that he might be of those possessing certainty:

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thus did We show Abraham the dominions of the heavens and the earth, that he might be of those who possess certitude.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And so We showed Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, so that he might be of those who are certain.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And thus did We show Abraham the realm of the heavens and the earth that he would be among the certain [in faith]

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Also, We showed (Abraham) the kingdom of the heavens and the earth to strengthen his faith.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And thus did We show Ibrahim the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and that he might be of those who are sure.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: In this way We showed Abraham Our kingdom of the heavens and the earth, so that he might have certainty of faith.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So also did We show Abraham the power and the laws of the heavens and the earth, that he might (with understanding) have certitude.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When the night came with her covering of darkness he saw a star, and (Azar, his father) said: "This is my Lord." But when the star set, (Abraham) said: "I love not those that wane."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When night outspread over him he saw a star and said, 'This is my Lord.' But when it set he said, 'I love not the setters.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when the night darkened on him, he beheld a star. He said: this is mine Lord. Then when it set, he said. I love not the setting ones.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When the night covered him over with darkness he saw a star. He said: "This is my lord." But when it set, he said: "I like not those that set."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When the night fell over him, he saw a planet. He said, “This is my lord.” But when it set, he said, “I do not love those that set.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then, when the night outspread over him, he beheld a star, and said: 'This is my Lord.' But when it went down, he said: 'I do not love the things that go down.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When the night overcame him he saw a Kawkab. He said: "This is my lord." But when it Afala, he said: "I like not those that set."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When the night grew dark upon him he beheld a star. He said: This is my Lord. But when it set, he said: I love not things that set.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When night darkened over him, he saw a star and said, ‘This is my Lord!’ But when it set, he said, ‘I do not like those who set.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When night drew over him, he saw a planet. 'This' he said: 'is surely my Lord' But when it set he said: 'I do not like the setting ones'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So when the night covered him [with darkness], he saw a star. He said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "I like not those that disappear."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When it became dark at night, he (Abraham) saw a star and said, "This is my lord." But when it disappeared, he said, "I do not love those who fade away".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when the night over-shadowed him, he saw a star; said he: Is this my Lord? So when it set, he said: I do not love the setting ones.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When night descended on him, he saw a star. He said, "This is my Lord!" Then when it set he said, "I do not love things that set."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When the night covered him over, He saw a star: He said: "This is my Lord." But when it set, He said: "I love not those that set."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When (Azar) saw the moon rise all aglow, he said: "This is my Lord." But even as the moon set, (Abraham) said: "If my Lord had not shown me the way I would surely have gone astray."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Then when he saw the moon shining, he said, “(You proclaim that) this is my Lord?”; then when it set, he said, “If my Lord had not guided me*, I too would be one of these astray people.” (* Prophet Ibrahim was rightly guided before this event).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When he saw the moon rising, he said, 'This is my Lord.' But when it set he said, 'If my Lord does not guide me I shall surely be of the people gone astray.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when he beheld the moon uprise, he said: this is mine Lord. Then when it set, he said: were it not that my Lord kept me guiding, surely I must have been of the erring people.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When he saw the moon rising up, he said: "This is my lord." But when it set, he said: "Unless my Lord guides me, I shall surely be among the erring people."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then, when he saw the moon rising, he said, “This is my lord.” But when it set, he said, “If my Lord does not guide me, I will be one of the erring people.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then, when he beheld the moon rising, he said: 'This is my Lord!' But when it went down, he said: 'Were that my Lord did not guide me, I surely would have become among the people who have gone astray.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When he saw the moon rising up, he said: "This is my lord." But when it set, he said: "Unless my Lord guides me, I shall surely be among the misguided people."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when he saw the moon uprising, he exclaimed: This is my Lord. But when it set, he said: Unless my Lord guide me, I surely shall become one of the folk who are astray.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then, when he saw the moon rising, he said, ‘This is my Lord!’ But when it set, he said, ‘Had my Lord not guided me, I would surely have been among the astray lot.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When he saw the rising moon, he said: 'This is my Lord' But when it set, he said: 'If my Lord does not guide me, I shall surely be amongst the astray nation'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when he saw the moon rising, he said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "Unless my Lord guides me, I will surely be among the people gone astray."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Abraham saw the rising moon, he said, "This is my lord." But when it faded away, he said, "If my Lord does not guide me I shall certainly go astray."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then when he saw the moon rising, he said: Is this my Lord? So when it set, he said: If my Lord had not guided me I should certainly be of the erring people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When he saw the moon rise and spread its light, he said, "This is my Lord." But when it set, he said, "If my Lord does not guide me, I will be one of the misguided people."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When he saw the moon rising in splendour, he said: "This is my Lord." But when the moon set, He said: "unless my Lord guide me, I shall surely be among those who go astray."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When (Azar) saw the sun rise all resplendent, he said: "My Lord is surely this, and the greatest of them all." But the sun also set, and (Abraham) said: "O my people, I am through with those you associate (with God).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When he saw the sun rising, he said, 'This is my Lord; this is greater!' But when it set he said, 'O my people, surely I am quit of that you associate.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when he beheld the sun uprise, he said: this is mine Lord; this is the greatest. Then when it set, he said: O my people! verily I am quit of that which ye associate.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When he saw the sun rising up, he said: "This is my lord. This is greater." But when it set, he said: "O my people! I am indeed free from all that you join as partners in worship with Allah.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then, when he saw the sun rising, he said, “This is my lord, this is bigger.” But when it set, he said, “O my people, I am innocent of your idolatry.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then when he beheld the sun rising, he said: 'This is my Lord. This is the greatest of all.' Then, when it went down, he said: 'O my people! Most certainly I am quit of those whom you associate with Allah in His divinity.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When he saw the sun rising up, he said: "This is my lord. This is greater." But when it Afalat, he said: "O my people! I am indeed free from all that you join as partners in worship with Allah.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when he saw the sun uprising, he cried: This is my Lord! This is greater! And when it set he exclaimed: O my people! Lo! I am free from all that ye associate (with Him).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then, when he saw the sun rising, he said, ‘This is my Lord! This is bigger!’ But when it set, he said, ‘O my people, indeed I disown what you take as [His] partners.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then, when he saw the sun rise, shining, he said: 'This must be my Lord, it is larger' But when it set, he said: 'O nation I am quit of what you associate (with Allah, the Creator),

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when he saw the sun rising, he said, "This is my lord; this is greater." But when it set, he said, "O my people, indeed I am free from what you associate with Allah.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When he saw the rising sun, he said, "This is my Lord for it is greater (than the others)." But when this too faded away, (Abraham) said, "My people, I disavow whatever you consider equal to God.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then when he saw the sun rising, he said: Is this my Lord? Is this the greatest? So when it set, he said: O my people! surely I am clear of what you set up (with Allah).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then, when he saw the sun shining, he said, "This is my Lord! This is the greatest of all!" Then when it set, he said, "My people, I disown all that you worship besides God.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When he saw the sun rising in splendour, he said: "This is my Lord; this is the greatest (of all)." But when the sun set, he said: "O my people! I am indeed free from your (guilt) of giving partners to Allah.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: I have truly turned my face towards Him who created the heavens and the earth: I have chosen one way and am not an idolater."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “I have directed my attention towards Him Who has created the heavens and the earth, am devoted solely to Him, and am not of the polytheists.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: I have turned my face to Him who originated the heavens and the earth, a man of pure faith; I am not of the idolaters.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily I have set my countenance towards Him who hath created the heavens and the earth, upright, and am not of the associaters.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, I have turned my face towards Him Who has created the heavens and the earth Hanifa (Islamic Monotheism, i.e. worshipping none but Allah Alone) and I am not of Al-Mushrikun (see V. 2:105)".

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: I have directed my attention towards Him Who created the heavens and the earth—a monotheist—and I am not of the idolaters.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Behold, I have turned my face in exclusive devotion to the One Who originated the heavens and the earth, and I am certainly not one of those who associate others with Allah in His divinity.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Verily, I have turned my face towards Him Who has created the heavens and the earth, Hanifan, and I am not of the idolators."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! I have turned my face toward Him Who created the heavens and the earth, as one by nature upright, and I am not of the idolaters.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Indeed I have turned my face toward Him who originated the heavens and the earth, as a Hanif, and I am not one of the polytheists.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: I have turned my face to Him who has created the heavens and the earth, uprightly, and I am not among the idolaters'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, I have turned my face toward He who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward truth, and I am not of those who associate others with Allah."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: I have up-rightly submitted myself to the One who has created the heavens and the earth and I am not an idol worshipper."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely I have turned myself, being upright, wholly to Him Who originated the heavens and the earth, and I am not of the polytheists.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Innee wajjahtu wajhiya lillathee fatara alssamawati waalarda haneefan wama ana mina almushrikeena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: I have set my face with single-minded devotion, towards Him who has created the heavens and the earth, and I am not one of the polytheists."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "For me, I have set my face, firmly and truly, towards Him Who created the heavens and the earth, and never shall I give partners to Allah."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: His people argued, and he said: "Do you argue with me about God? He has guided me already, and I fear not what you associate with Him, unless my Lord wills, for held within the knowledge of my Lord is everything. Will you not reflect?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: His people disputed with him. He said, 'Do you dispute with me concerning God, and He has guided me? I fear not what you associate with Him, except my Lord will aught. My Lord embraces all things in His knowledge; will you not remember?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And his people contended with him. He said; contend ye with me concerning Allah when He hath surely guided me? I fear not that which ye associate with Him save aught that mine Lord may will. My Lord comprehendeth everything in His Knowledge. Will ye not then be admonished?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: His people disputed with him. He said: "Do you dispute with me concerning Allah while He has guided me, and I fear not those whom you associate with Allah in worship. (Nothing can happen to me) except when my Lord (Allah) wills something. My Lord comprehends in His Knowledge all things. Will you not then remember?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And his people argued with him. He said, “Do you argue with me about God, when He has guided me? I do not fear what you associate with Him, unless my Lord wills it. My Lord comprehends all things in knowledge. Will you not reconsider?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: His. people remonstrated with him whereupon Abraharn said: 'Do you remonstrate with me concerning Allah Who has guided me to the right way? I do not fear those whom you associate with Allah in His divinity. Only that which my Lord wills, indeed that alone will come by. My Lord embraces all things within His knowledge. Will you not take heed?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: His people disputed with him. He said: "Do you dispute with me about Allah while He has guided me, and I fear not those whom you associate with Allah in worship. (Nothing can happen to me) except when my Lord wills something. My Lord comprehends in His knowledge all things. Will you not then remember

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: His people argued with him. He said: Dispute ye with me concerning Allah when He hath guided me? I fear not at all that which ye set up beside Him unless my Lord willeth aught. My Lord includeth all things in His knowledge. Will ye not then remember?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: His people argued with him. He said, ‘Do you argue with me concerning Allah, while He has guided me for certain? I do not fear what you ascribe to Him as [His] partners, excepting anything that my Lord may wish. My Lord embraces all things in [His] knowledge. Will you not then take admonition?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: His nation argued with him. He said: 'Will you argue with me about Allah, indeed He guided me! Except by His will, I do not fear those you associate with Him. My Lord embraces all things in knowledge, will you not remember?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And his people argued with him. He said, "Do you argue with me concerning Allah while He has guided me? And I fear not what you associate with Him [and will not be harmed] unless my Lord should will something. My Lord encompasses all things in knowledge; then will you not remember?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: In an argument with his people, (Abraham) asked them, "Why do you argue with me about God who has given me guidance? Your idols can do no harm to me unless God wills. God knows all things. Why, then, do you not consider this?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And his people disputed with him. He said: Do you dispute with me respecting Allah? And He has guided me indeed; and I do not fear in any way those that you set up with Him, unless my Lord pleases; my Lord comprehends all things in His knowledge; will you not then mind?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: His people argued with him. He said, "Are you arguing with me about God, while He has guided me? I have no fear of any partner you ascribe to Him, unless my Lord should wish otherwise. My Lord encompasses all things in His knowledge, so will you not pay heed?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: His people disputed with him. He said: "(Come) ye to dispute with me, about Allah, when He (Himself) hath guided me? I fear not (the beings) ye associate with Allah: Unless my Lord willeth, (nothing can happen). My Lord comprehendeth in His knowledge all things. Will ye not (yourselves) be admonished?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: This is the argument We gave to Abraham against his people. We exalt whosoever We please in rank by degrees. Your Lord is wise and all-knowing.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And this is Our argument, which We gave Ibrahim against his people; We raise to high ranks whomever We will; indeed your Lord is Wise, All Knowing.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: That is Our argument, which We bestowed upon Abraham as against his people. We raise up in degrees whom We will; surely thy Lord is All-wise, All-knowing.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And this was Our argument which We vouchsafed unto Ibrahim against his people. We raise in degrees whomsoever We list; verily thy Lord is Wise, Knowing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And that was Our Proof which We gave Ibrahim (Abraham) against his people. We raise whom We will in degrees. Certainly your Lord is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: That was Our argument which We gave to Abraham against his people. We elevate by degrees whomever We will. Your Lord is Wise and Informed.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: That was Our argument which We gave to Abraham against his people. We raise in ranks whom We will. Truly your lord is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And that was Our proof which We gave Ibrahim against his people. We in degrees raise whom We will. Certainly your Lord is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: That is Our argument. We gave it unto Abraham against his folk. We raise unto degrees of wisdom whom We will. Lo! thy Lord is Wise, Aware.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: This was Our argument that We gave to Abraham against his people. We raise in rank whomever We wish. Indeed your Lord is all-wise, all-knowing.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Such is the argument that We gave Abraham against his nation. We raise whom We will to an exalted rank. Your Lord is Wise, Knowing.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And that was Our [conclusive] argument which We gave Abraham against his people. We raise by degrees whom We will. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Such was the authoritative reasoning that We gave Abraham over his people. We raise whomever We want to a higher rank. Your Lord is All-wise and All-knowing.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And this was Our argument which we gave to Ibrahim against his people; We exalt in dignity whom We please; surely your Lord is Wise, Knowing.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: This is the reasoning We gave to Abraham against his people, We raise in rank anyone We please, your Lord is wise and aware.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: That was the reasoning about Us, which We gave to Abraham (to use) against his people: We raise whom We will, degree after degree: for thy Lord is full of wisdom and knowledge.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Commemorate Abraham in the Book: He was upright, a prophet.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember Ibrahim in the Book; he was very truthful, a Herald of the Hidden (a Prophet).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And mention in the Book Abraham; surely he was a true man, a Prophet.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And mention thou in the Book Ibrahim; verily he was a man of truth, a prophet.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And mention in the Book (the Quran) Ibrahim (Abraham). Verily! He was a man of truth, a Prophet.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And mention in the Scripture Abraham. He was a man of truth, a prophet.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad), recite in the Book the account of Abraham. Most surely he was a man of truth, a Prophet.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Ibrahim. Verily, he was a man of truth, a Prophet.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And make mention (O Muhammad) in the Scripture of Abraham. Lo! he was a saint, a prophet.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And mention in the Book Abraham. Indeed, he was a truthful man and a prophet.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Mention in the Book Abraham; He was truthful and a Prophet.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Mention the story of Abraham, the truthful Prophet, in the Book (the Quran)

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And mention Ibrahim in the Book; surely he was a truthful man, a prophet.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Also recount the story of Abraham in the Book. He was a man of truth, and a prophet.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: He was a man of Truth, a prophet.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember, when he said to his father: "O my father, why do you worship that which can neither hear nor see nor even profit you the least?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: When he said to his father,* “O my father – why do you worship one which neither hears nor sees, and cannot benefit you in any way?” (* His uncle Azar.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When he said to his father, 'Father, why worshippest thou that which neither hears nor sees, nor avails thee anything?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Recall what time he said unto his father:, O my father! wherefore worshippest thou that which heareth not and seeth not, nor availeth thee at all?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When he said to his father: "O my father! Why do you worship that which hears not, sees not and cannot avail you in anything?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said to his father, “O my father, why do you worship what can neither hear, nor see, nor benefit you in any way?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (And remind people) when he said to his father: "Father! Why do you worship that which neither sees nor hears, and which can be of no avail to you?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When he said to his father: "O my father! Why do you worship that which hears not, sees not and cannot avail you in anything"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When he said unto his father: O my father! Why worshippest thou that which heareth not nor seeth, nor can in aught avail thee?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When he said to his father, ‘Father! Why do you worship that which neither hears nor sees, and is of no avail to you in any way?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said to his father: 'O father, why worship that which can neither see nor hear, nor helps you in anything?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Mention] when he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: who asked his father, "Father, why do you worship something that can neither hear nor see nor help you at all?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When he said to his father; O my father! why do you worship what neither hears nor sees, nor does it avail you in the least:

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Ith qala liabeehi ya abati lima taAAbudu ma la yasmaAAu wala yubsiru wala yughnee AAanka shayan

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He said to his father, "Why do you worship something that can neither hear nor see nor benefit you in any way?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold, he said to his father: "O my father! why worship that which heareth not and seeth not, and can profit thee nothing?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O my father, to me has come such knowledge as never came to you. So follow me that I may show you the right path.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O my father, indeed a knowledge has come to me which did not come to you – therefore follow me, I will show you the Straight Path.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Father, there has come to me knowledge such as came not to thee; so follow me, and I will guide thee on a level path.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O My father! verily there hath come to me of the knowledge which hath not come unto thee; so follow me, and I shall guide thee to a path even.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O my father! Verily! There has come to me of knowledge that which came not unto you. So follow me. I will guide you to a Straight Path.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O my father, there has come to me knowledge that never came to you. So follow me, and I will guide you along a straight way.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Father, a knowledge that has not reached you has come to me. So follow me that I may guide you to a Straight Way.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O my father! Verily, there has come to me the knowledge of that which came not unto you. So follow me, I will guide you to the straight path."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O my father! Lo! there hath come unto me of knowledge that which came not unto thee. So follow me, and I will lead thee on a right path.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Father! Indeed a knowledge has already come to me, which has not come to you. So follow me that I may guide you to a right path.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Father, knowledge has come to me which has not come you, therefore, follow me. I will guide you to a Level Path.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Father, I have received the knowledge which has not been given to you. Follow me; I shall guide you to the right path.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O my father! truly the knowledge has come to me which has not come to you, therefore follow me, I will guide you on a right path:

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Ya abati innee qad jaanee mina alAAilmi ma lam yatika faittabiAAnee ahdika siratan sawiyyan

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Father, I have been given some knowledge which has not come to you, so follow me: I shall guide you along a straight path.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O my father! to me hath come knowledge which hath not reached thee: so follow me: I will guide thee to a way that is even and straight.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Why do you worship Satan, O father? Verily Satan was disobedient to Ar-Rahman.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O my father, do not be a bondman of the devil; indeed the devil is disobedient towards the Most Gracious.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Father, serve not Satan; surely Satan is a rebel against the All-merciful.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O My father! worship not the satan; hath been Unto the Compassionate a rebel.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O my father! Worship not Shaitan (Satan). Verily! Shaitan (Satan) has been a rebel against the Most Beneficent (Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O my father, do not worship the devil. The devil is disobedient to the Most Gracious.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Father, do not serve Satan, for Satan has indeed been a persistent rebel against the Most Compassionate Lord.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O my father! Worship not Shaytan. Verily, Shaytan has been a rebel against the Most Gracious."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O my father! Serve not the devil. Lo! the devil is a rebel unto the Beneficent.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Father! Do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan is disobedient to the All-beneficent.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Father, do not worship satan; for satan has rebelled against the Merciful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Father, do not worship satan; he has disobeyed the Beneficent God.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O my father! serve not the Shaitan, surely the Shaitan is disobedient to the Beneficent Allah:

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Ya abati la taAAbudi alshshaytana inna alshshaytana kana lilrrahmani AAasiyyan

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Father! Do not worship Satan -- for, truly, Satan is a rebel against the Most Gracious One!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O my father! serve not Satan: for Satan is a rebel against (Allah) Most Gracious.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O my father, I fear lest a punishment from Ar-Rahman should befall you, and you should become a friend of the Devil."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O my father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Gracious may reach you, so you would become a companion of the devil.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Father, I fear that some chastisement from the All-merciful will smite thee, so that thou becomest a friend to Satan.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O My father! verily I fear that there may touch thee a torment from the Compassionate so that thou become to the Satan a companin.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O my father! Verily! I fear lest a torment from the Most Beneficent (Allah) overtake you, so that you become a companion of Shaitan (Satan) (in the Hell-fire)." [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi]

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O my father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Gracious will afflict you, and you become an ally of the devil.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Compassionate Lord might strike you and you may end up as one of Satan's companions?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O my father! Verily, I fear lest a torment from the Most Gracious should overtake you, so that you become a companion of Shaytan."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O my father! Lo! I fear lest a punishment from the Beneficent overtake thee so that thou become a comrade of the devil.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Father! I am indeed afraid that a punishment from the All-beneficent will befall you, and you will become Satan’s accomplice.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Father, I fear that the punishment of the Merciful will fall upon you and you will become a guide of satan'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Father, I am afraid that the Beneficent God's torment will strike you and you will become a friend of satan."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O my father! surely I fear that a punishment from the Beneficent Allah should afflict you so that you should be a friend of the Shaitan.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Ya abati innee akhafu an yamassaka AAathabun mina alrrahmani fatakoona lilshshyatani waliyyan

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Father, indeed I fear lest a punishment from the Gracious One afflict you, and you become a friend of Satan."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O my father! I fear lest a Penalty afflict thee from (Allah) Most Gracious, so that thou become to Satan a friend."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "Are you averse to my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall have you stoned to death. So go away for a while from me."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He said, “What! You turn away from my Gods, O Ibrahim? If you do not desist, I will certainly stone you, and keep no relation with me for a long while.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he, 'What, art thou shrinking from my gods, Abraham? Surely, if thou givest not over, I shall stone thee; so forsake me now for some while.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: art thou averse to my gods, O Ibrahim? If thou desistest not, surely I shall stone thee; and depart from me for ever so long.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He (the father) said: "Do you reject my gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)? If you stop not (this), I will indeed stone you. So get away from me safely before I punish you."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Are you renouncing my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will stone you. So leave me alone for a while.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The father said: "Abraham, have you turned away from my gods? If you do not give this up, I shall stone you to death. Now begone from me forever."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He (the father) said: "Do you revile my gods, O Ibrahim If you stop not (this), I will La'arjumannak. So get away from me Maliyan."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Rejectest thou my gods, O Abraham? If thou cease not, I shall surely stone thee. Depart from me a long while!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Abraham! Are you renouncing my gods? If you do not desist, I will stone you. Get away from me for a long while.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But he replied: 'Do you shrink away from my gods, Abraham? Surely, if you do not cease I will stone you, so leave me for awhile'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."

translation.author: Sarwar
