translation.text: His father replied, "Abraham, are you telling me to give-up my gods? If you will not stop this, I shall stone you to death. Leave my house and do not come back again".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Do you dislike my gods, O Ibrahim? If you do not desist I will certainly revile you, and leave me for a time.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: [His father] said, "Do you reject my deities, Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall surely stone you to death. Keep out of my way!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods, O Abraham? If thou forbear not, I will indeed stone thee: Now get away from me for a good long while!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He answered: "Peace be on you. I will seek forgiveness of my Lord for you. He has been gracious to me.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Peace be upon thee! I will ask my Lord to forgive thee; surely He is ever gracious to me.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Ibrahim said: peace be on thee! anon shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for thee; verily He is unto me ever so soicitous.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "Peace be on you! I will ask Forgiveness of my Lord for you. Verily! He is unto me, Ever Most Gracious.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Peace be upon you. I will ask my Lord to forgive you; He has been Kind to me.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham answered: "Peace be upon you. I shall seek pardon for you from my Lord. My Lord has always been kind to Me.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Ibrahim said: "Peace be on you! I will ask forgiveness of my Lord for you. Verily, He is unto me Hafiyyan.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Peace be unto thee! I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for thee. Lo! He was ever gracious unto me.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Peace be to you! I shall plead with my Lord to forgive you. Indeed, He is gracious to me.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Peace be on you' he (Abraham) said, 'I shall call upon my Lord to forgive you, for to me He has been gracious.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Abraham] said, "Peace will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham said, "Peace be with you. I shall ask my Lord to forgive you; He has been gracious to me.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Peace be on you, I will pray to my Lord to forgive you; surely He is ever Affectionate to me:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham replied, "Peace be on you: I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness, He has indeed been gracious to me,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy forgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: I will leave you and those you invoke apart from God, and pray to my Lord. Haply in praying to my Lord I will not be deprived."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: "And I shall remain separated from you and all that you worship other than Allah and shall worship my Lord; possibly, by worshipping my Lord, I will not be amongst the unfortunate.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Now I will go apart from you and that you call upon, apart from God; I will call upon my Lord, and haply I shall not be, in calling upon my Lord, unprosperous.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And I renounce you and that unto which ye call beside Allah; and I shall call unto my Lord; belike in calling unto my Lord I shall not be unblest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And I shall turn away from you and from those whom you invoke besides Allah. And I shall call on my Lord; and I hope that I shall not be unblest in my invocation to my Lord."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And I will withdraw from you, and from what you pray to instead of God. And I will pray to my Lord, and I hope I will not be disappointed in my prayer to my Lord.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: I shall withdraw from you and all that you call upon beside Allah. I shall only call upon my Lord. I trust the prayer to my Lord will not go unanswered."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And I shall turn away from you and from those whom you invoke besides Allah. And I shall call upon my Lord, and I certainly hope that I shall not be unblessed in my invocation to my Lord."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: I shall withdraw from you and that unto which ye pray beside Allah, and I shall pray unto my Lord. It may be that, in prayer unto my Lord, I shall not be unblest.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: I dissociate myself from you and whatever you invoke besides Allah. I will supplicate my Lord. Hopefully, I will not be disappointed in supplicating my Lord.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Now I will go away from you and that you call upon, other than Allah. I will call on my Lord. Perhaps I shall not be unblessed in calling my Lord'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allah and will invoke my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: I shall stay away from you and what you worship instead of God. I worship my Lord and hope that my prayers will not be ignored."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And I will withdraw from you and what you call on besides Allah, and I will call upon my Lord; may be I shall not remain unblessed in calling upon my Lord.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: WaaAAtazilukum wama tadAAoona min dooni Allahi waadAAoo rabbee AAasa alla akoona biduAAai rabbee shaqiyyan

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: I will separate myself from you and from whatever you call upon besides God, and I will pray only to my Lord. It may well be that, in calling on my Lord, I will not be disappointed."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "And I will turn away from you (all) and from those whom ye invoke besides Allah: I will call on my Lord: perhaps, by my prayer to my Lord, I shall be not unblest."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Relate the news of Abraham to them.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And recite to them the news of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And recite to them the tiding of Abraham

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recite unto them the story of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim (Abraham).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And relate to them the story of Abraham.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recount to them the story of Abraham:

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Recite unto them the story of Abraham:

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Relate to them the account of Abraham

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And recite to them the news of Abraham.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And recite to them the news of Abraham,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Your Lord is certainly Majestic and All-merciful.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Tell them the story of Abraham,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: when he said to his father and his people, 'What do you serve?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: When he said unto his father and his people: what worship ye?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: when he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What do you worship"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When he said unto his father and his folk: What worship ye?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: when he said to his father and his people, ‘What is it that you are worshiping?!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said to his father and to his nation: 'What do you worship'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Tell them the story of Abraham,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: What do you worship?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: when he asked his father and his people, "What is that which you worship?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold, he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They replied: "We worship idols and are devoted to them."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “We worship idols, and we keep squatting in seclusion before them.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'We serve idols, and continue cleaving to them.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: we worship idols, and we are unto them ever devoted

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "We worship idols, and to them we are ever devoted."

translation.author: Itani

translation.text: The Day whereon will profit neither substance nor sons.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The Day when neither wealth nor children will help.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: the Day when nothing will avail, neither wealth nor offspring,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The day when wealth and sons avail not (any man)

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: the day when neither wealth nor children will avail,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The Day when neither wealth nor sons shall benefit

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: on the Day of Judgment when neither wealth nor children will be of any benefit

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The day on which property will not avail, nor sons

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Yawma la yanfaAAu malun wala banoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: the Day when wealth and sons will be of no avail,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But to him who comes to God with a tranquil heart."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Except he who presented himself before Allah, with a sound* heart.” (Intact or unblemished.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: except for him who comes to God with a pure heart.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Unless it be he, who shall bring unto Allah a whole heart,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Except him who brings to Allah a clean heart [clean from Shirk (polytheism) and Nifaq (hypocrisy)].

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Except for him who comes to God with a sound heart.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: but only he that brings to Allah a sound heart will (attain to success)."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Except him who brings to Allah a clean heart.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Save him who bringeth unto Allah a whole heart.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: except him who comes to Allah with a sound heart,’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: except him who comes before Allah with a pure heart;

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But only one who comes to Allah with a sound heart."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: except what is done in obedience to God with a submissive heart.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Except him who comes to Allah with a heart free (from evil).

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Illa man ata Allaha biqalbin saleemin

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and when he alone will be saved who comes to God with a sound heart."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "But only he (will prosper) that brings to Allah a sound heart;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When Abraham said to his father and his people: "I am rid of what you worship

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And when Ibrahim said to his father and his people, “I have no relation whatsoever with your deities.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Abraham said to his father and his people, 'Surely I am quit of that you serve,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Ibrahim said Unto his father and his people: verily I am quit of that which ye worship.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father and his people: "Verily, I am innocent of what you worship,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When Abraham said to his father and his people, “I am innocent of what you worship.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Call to mind when Abraham said to his father and his people: “I totally disown all whom you serve

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim said to his father and his people: "Verily, I am innocent of what you worship,"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Abraham said unto his father and his folk: Lo! I am innocent of what ye worship

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Abraham said to his father and his people, ‘I repudiate what you worship,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Remember) when Abraham, said to his father and his nation: 'I am quit from what you worship,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father and his people, "Indeed, I am disassociated from that which you worship

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Abraham said to his father and his people, "I boldly renounce what you worship

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Ibrahim said to his father and his people: Surely I am clear of what you worship,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Call to mind when Abraham said to his father and his people, "I disown utterly that which you worship.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! Abraham said to his father and his people: "I do indeed clear myself of what ye worship:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We had earlier given Abraham true direction, for We knew him well.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed We bestowed Ibrahim with guidance from the beginning, and We were Aware of him.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We gave Abraham aforetime his rectitude -- for We knew him --

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed un to lbrahim his rectitude aforetime, and him We had ever known.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We bestowed aforetime on Ibrahim (Abraham) his (portion of) guidance, and We were Well-Acquainted with him (as to his Belief in the Oneness of Allah, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Abraham his integrity formerly, and We knew him well.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely We had bestowed wisdom upon Abraham even earlier, and We knew him well.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We bestowed aforetime on Ibrahim his guidance, and We were Well-Acquainted with him.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Abraham of old his proper course, and We were Aware of him,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We had given Abraham his probity before, and We knew him

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Before this We gave Abraham his virtue, for We knew him.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To Abraham We gave the right guidance and We knew him very well.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave to Ibrahim his rectitude before, and We knew him fully well.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Before this We gave Abraham his guidance. We knew him well.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct, and well were We acquainted with him.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these idols to which you cling so passionately?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: when he said to his father and his people, 'What are these statues unto which you are cleaving?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Recall what time he said unto his father and his people what are these images to which ye are cleaving?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these images, to which you are devoted?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people, “What are these statues to which you are devoted?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Recall, when he said to his father and his people: "What are these images to which you are devoutly clinging?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these images to which you are devoted"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When he said unto his father and his folk: What are these images unto which ye pay devotion?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: when he said to his father and his people, ‘What are these images to which you keep on clinging?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said to his father and to his nation: 'What, are these the statues to which you cling'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham asked his father and his people, "What are these statues which you worship?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: What are these images to whose worship you cleave?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When he asked his father and his people, "What are these images to which you are so devoted?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! he said to his father and his people, "What are these images, to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They replied: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “We found our forefathers worshipping them.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'We found our fathers serving them.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: we found our fathers the worshippers thereof.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said:"We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “We found our parents worshiping them.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They answered: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: We found our fathers worshippers of them.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘We found our fathers worshipping them.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They replied: 'We found our fathers worshipping them'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They replied, "We found our fathers worshipping them".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: We found our fathers worshipping them.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo wajadna abaana laha AAabideena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They replied, "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "You and your fathers were in clear error."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Then assuredly you and your fathers have been in manifest error.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: assuredlY ye, ye and your fathers, have been in error manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He said: "Indeed you and your fathers have been in manifest error."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “You and your parents are in evident error.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He said: "Certainly you and your fathers have all been in manifest error."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Indeed you and your fathers have been in manifest error."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Verily ye and your fathers were in plain error.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Certainly you and your fathers have been in manifest error.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'Truly, you and your fathers are in clear error'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "Both you and your fathers have certainly been in error."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Certainly you have been, (both) you and your fathers, in manifest error.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham said, "Indeed, you and your fathers have been clearly misguided."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said, "Indeed ye have been in manifest error - ye and your fathers."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "Are you speaking in earnest, or only jesting?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Have you brought the Truth to us, or are you just making fun?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'What, hast thou come to us with the truth, or art thou one of those that play?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: hast thou come unto us with the truth, or art thou of those who sport?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Have you brought us the truth, or are you one of those who play about?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Are you telling us the truth, or are you just playing?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: "Are you expressing your true ideas before us or are you jesting?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you one of those who play about"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Bringest thou unto us the truth, or art thou some jester?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Are you telling the truth, or are you [just] kidding?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'Is it the truth you have brought us, or are you one of those that play'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They exclaimed, "Have you brought the Truth or are you joking?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Have you brought to us the truth, or are you one of the triflers?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo ajitana bialhaqqi am anta mina allaAAibeena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Have you brought us the truth or are you jesting?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you one of those who jest?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "In fact it was your Lord, the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who created them; and I bear witness to this.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who originated them, and I am one of those that bear witness thereunto.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: Aye! your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth Who created them, and as to that I am of the witnesses.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He said: "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them and of that I am one of the witnesses.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the One who created them, and I bear witness to that.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He said: "Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth which He created and to that I bear witness before you.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them and to that I am one of the witnesses."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them; and I am of those who testify unto that.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Indeed, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who originated them, and I affirm that.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'No' he answered, 'your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Originator of them, and I am among those bearing witness to it.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. It was He who created them and I testify to this fact".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Nay! your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who brought them into existence, and I am of those who bear witness to this:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham replied, "Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who created them, and I bear witness to that.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: I swear by God I will do something to your idols when you have turned your backs and gone."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And, by God, I shall assuredly outwit your idols, after you have gone away turning your backs.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And by Allah I shall surely devise a plot against your idols after ye turned away backward.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And by Allah, I shall plot a plan (to destroy) your idols after you have gone away and turned your backs."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “By God, I will have a plan for your statues after you have gone away.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: By Allah, I shall certainly carry out my plan against your gods after you are gone."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And by Allah, I shall plot a plan for your idols after you have gone away and turned your backs."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And, by Allah, I shall circumvent your idols after ye have gone away and turned your backs.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: By Allah, I will devise a stratagem against your idols after you have gone away.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: By Allah, I will certainly outwit your idols as soon as you have turned your backs and gone'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [I swear] by Allah, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham said to himself, "By God! I will devise a plan against their idols when they are away."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And, by Allah! I will certainly do something against your idols after you go away, turning back.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: By the Lord, I will devise a plan against your deities after you have gone away and turned your backs!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "And by Allah, I have a plan for your idols - after ye go away and turn your backs"..

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So he smashed them up to pieces with the exception of the biggest, so that they may turn to it.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He shattered them all, except the biggest among them, that perhaps they may question it.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So he broke them into fragments, all but a great one they had, for haply they would return to it.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he made them fragments, all except the big one of them, that haply unto it they may return.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So he broke them to pieces, (all) except the biggest of them, that they might turn to it.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So he reduced them into pieces, except for their biggest, that they may return to it.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then he broke them all into pieces, sparing only the supreme one among them that they may possibly return to him.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So he broke them to pieces, except the biggest of them, that they might turn to it.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then he reduced them to fragments, all save the chief of them, that haply they might have recourse to it.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So he broke them into pieces—all except the biggest of them—so that they might come back to it.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He broke them all into pieces, except their great one so that they might return to it.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He broke all the idols into pieces, except the biggest among them so that perhaps people would refer to it.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So he broke them into pieces, except the chief of them, that haply they may return to it.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: FajaAAalahum juthathan illa kabeeran lahum laAAallahum ilayhi yarjiAAoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He broke them all into pieces, except for the biggest one of them, so that they might return to it [for enquiry].

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So he broke them to pieces, (all) but the biggest of them, that they might turn (and address themselves) to it.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They asked (on return): "Who has done this to our gods? He is surely a mischief-monger."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Who has done this to our Gods? He is indeed cruel!”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Who has. done this with our gods? Surely he is one of the evildoers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: who hath wrought this to our gods? verily he is of the wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Who has done this to our aliha (gods)? He must indeed be one of the wrong-doers."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Who did this to our gods? He is certainly one of the wrongdoers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (When they saw the idols in this state) they said: "Who has done this to our gods? Surely he is one of the wrong-doers."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Who has done this to our gods He must indeed be one of the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Who hath done this to our gods? Surely it must be some evil-doer.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Whoever has done this to Our gods?! He is indeed a wrongdoer!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Who has done this to our gods' they exclaimed. 'He must surely be a harmdoer'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (When the people came to the temple and saw the broken idols) they asked each other, "Who has done this to our gods? He certainly is an unjust person".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Who has done this to our gods? Most surely he is one of the unjust.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo man faAAala hatha bialihatina innahu lamina alththalimeena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "Who has done this to our deities? He must be a wrongdoer."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some man of impiety!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "We heard a youth talk about them. He is called Abraham."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Some among them said, “We heard a youth speak ill of them – the one called Ibrahim.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'We heard a young man making mention of them, and he was called Abraham.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: We heard a youth speak of them, who is called Ibrahim.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "We heard a young man talking (against) them who is called Ibrahim (Abraham)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “We heard a youth mentioning them. He is called Abraham.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Some of them said: "We heard a youth called Abraham speak (ill) of them."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "We heard a young man talking against them, who is called Ibrahim."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: We heard a youth make mention of them, who is called Abraham.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘We heard a young man mentioning them. He is called ‘‘Abraham.’’ ’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'We have heard a young man called Abraham mention them' they replied.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Some of them said, "We heard a youth called Abraham speaking against the idols".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: We heard a youth called Ibrahim speak of them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Some said, "We heard a young man, called Abraham, talking about them."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "We heard a youth talk of them: He is called Abraham."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Bring him before the people," they said, "that they may bear witness."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Therefore bring him in front of the people, perhaps they may testify.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Bring him before the people's eyes; haply they shall bear witness.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: bring him then before the eyes of the people, haply they may bear witness.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The others said: "Bring him, then, before the eyes of the people that they may see (what will be done to him)."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes that they may testify.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Bring him before the people’s eyes so that they may bear witness [against him].’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'Then bring him here so that the people may see, so that they may bear witness'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Their chiefs said, "Bring him before the eyes of the people and let them testify that he has spoken against the idols."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Said they: Then bring him before the eyes of the people, perhaps they may bear witness.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo fatoo bihi AAala aAAyuni alnnasi laAAallahum yashhadoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Then bring him here in the sight of all the people, so that they may act as witnesses."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Did you do this to our gods, O Abraham?" they enquired.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Did you do this to our Gods, O Ibrahim?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'So, art thou the man who did this unto our gods, Abraham?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: art thou the one who hath wrought this unto our gods, O Ibrahim?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Are you the one who has done this to our gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Are you the one who did this to our gods, O Abraham?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (On Abraham's arrival) they said: "Abraham, are you he who has done this to our gods?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Are you the one who has done this to our gods, O Ibrahim"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Is it thou who hast done this to our gods, O Abraham?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Was it you who did this to our gods, O Abraham?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Abraham' they said, 'was it you who did this to our gods'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They asked, "Abraham, did you do this to our idols?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Have you done this to our gods, O Ibrahim?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Abraham, was it you who did this to our deities?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Art thou the one that did this with our gods, O Abraham?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "No," he said. "It was done by that chief of theirs. Ask him in case they can speak."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'No; it was this great one of them that did it. Question them; if they are able to speak!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: rather he hath wrought it: this big one of them: so question them, if they ever speak.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Nay, this one, the biggest of them (idols) did it. Ask them, if they can speak!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “But it was this biggest of them that did it. Ask them, if they can speak.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He answered: "Rather it was this supreme one who has done it. So ask them, if they can speak."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Nay, this one, the biggest of them did it. Ask them, if they can speak!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: But this, their chief hath done it. So question them, if they can speak.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘No, it was this biggest one of them who did it! Ask them, if they can speak.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'No' he replied. 'It was their great one amongst them that did it. Ask them, if they are able to speak'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He replied, "I think the biggest among them has broken the smaller ones. Ask them if they are able to speak".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Surely (some doer) has done it; the chief of them is this, therefore ask them, if they can speak.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He answered, "Rather this biggest one of them did it. Ask them, if they can speak."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Nay, this was done by - this is their biggest one! ask them, if they can speak intelligently!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then they thought and observed: "Surely you are yourselves unjust."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So they turned towards their own selves and (inwardly) said, “Indeed you yourselves are unjust.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So they returned one to another, and they said, 'Surely it is you who are the evildoers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They then turned to themselves, and said: verily ye it is who are the wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So they turned to themselves and said: "Verily, you are the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then they turned to one another, and said, “You yourselves are the wrongdoers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon they turned to their (inner) selves and said (to themselves): "Surely it is you who are the wrong-doers."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So they turned to themselves and said: "Verily, you are the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then gathered they apart and said: Lo! ye yourselves are the wrong-doers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereat they came to themselves and said [to one another], ‘Indeed it is you who are the wrongdoers!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So they returned one to another saying, 'Surely, it is you who are the harmdoers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Thereupon they realized their own foolishness and said, "We ourselves are wrong-doers".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then they turned to themselves and said: Surely you yourselves are the unjust;

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: FarajaAAoo ila anfusihim faqaloo innakum antumu alththalimoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then they turned to one another and said, "It is you yourselves who are in the wrong,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So they turned to themselves and said, "Surely ye are the ones in the wrong!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then crestfallen (they confessed): "Truly, as you know, they cannot speak."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then they were utterly put to confusion saying, 'Very well indeed thou knowest these do not speak.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Thereafter they were made to turn over upon their heads, saying, assuredly thou knowest that they speak not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then they turned to themselves (their first thought and said): "Indeed you [Ibrahim (Abraham)] know well that these (idols) speak not!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But they reverted to their old ideas: “You certainly know that these do not speak.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then their minds were turned upside down, and they said: "You know well that they do not speak."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then they turned to themselves: "Indeed you know well that these speak not!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And they were utterly confounded, and they said: Well thou knowest that these speak not.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then they hung their heads. [However, they said,] ‘You certainly know that they cannot speak.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But then they reversed their minds: 'You know they do not speak'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then they reversed themselves, [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: With their heads cast down they said, "Abraham, you know that idols do not speak. How then can you ask such a question?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then they were made to hang down their heads: Certainly you know that they do not speak.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: then they hung their heads, and said, "O Abraham! You know they cannot speak."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then were they confounded with shame: (they said), "Thou knowest full well that these (idols) do not speak!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (So Abraham) said: "Then why do you worship something apart from God that cannot profit you or do you harm?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'What, and do you serve, apart from God, that which profits you nothing; neither hurts you?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: worship ye, then, beside Allah, that which profiteth you not at all, nor it hurteth you

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Do you then worship besides Allah, things that can neither profit you, nor harm you?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Do you worship, instead of God, what can neither benefit you in anything, nor harm you?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: "Do you, then, worship beside Allah a thing that can neither benefit you nor hurt you?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Do you then worship besides Allah, things that can neither profit you nor harm you"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Worship ye then instead of Allah that which cannot profit you at all, nor harm you?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Then, do you worship besides Allah that which cannot cause you any benefit or harm?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'Would you then worship that, instead of Allah, which can neither help nor harm you?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allah that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "Do you, instead of God, worship things that can neither harm nor benefit you?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: What! do you then serve besides Allah what brings you not any benefit at all, nor does it harm you?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham said, "So, do you worship something instead of God that can neither benefit you nor harm you?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Abraham) said, "Do ye then worship, besides Allah, things that can neither be of any good to you nor do you harm?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Fie on you and those you worship besides God! Will you not understand?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Disgrace be upon you and all the idols whom you worship instead of Allah; so do you not have sense?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Fie upon you and that you serve apart from God! Do you not understand?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Fie upon you and upon that which ye worship beside Allah! Will ye not then reflect?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Fie upon you, and upon that which you worship besides Allah! Have you then no sense?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Fie on you, and on what you worship instead of God. Do you not understand?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Fie upon you and upon all that you worship beside Allah. Do you have no sense?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Fie upon you, and upon that which you worship besides Allah! Have you then no sense"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Fie on you and all that ye worship instead of Allah! Have ye then no sense?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Fie on you and what you worship besides Allah! Do you not exercise your reason?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Shame on you and on that you worship other than Allah! Have you no understanding'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allah. Then will you not use reason?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Woe to you for what you worship instead of God. Have you no understanding?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Fie on you and on what you serve besides Allah; what! do you not then understand?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Offin lakum walima taAAbudoona min dooni Allahi afala taAAqiloona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Shame on you and on whatever you worship instead of God. Can you not understand?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Fie upon you, and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah! Have ye no sense?"..

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Turn cold, O fire," We said, "and give safety to Abraham."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: We said, “O fire, become cool and peaceful upon Ibrahim.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We said, 'O fire, be coolness and safety for Abraham!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: We said: O fire! be thou cool and peace unto Ibrahim

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: We (Allah) said: "O fire! Be you coolness and safety for Ibrahim (Abraham)!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We said, “O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We said: "O fire, become coolness and safety for Abraham."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: We said: "O fire! Be you cool and safety for Ibrahim!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We said: O fire, be coolness and peace for Abraham,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We said, ‘O fire! Be cool and safe for Abraham!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'O Fire' We said, 'be coolness and safety for Abraham'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Allah said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We said to the fire, "Be cool and peaceful (with Abraham)".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: We said: O fire! be a comfort and peace to Ibrahim;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But We said, "Fire! Be cool and a means of safety for Abraham."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We said, "O Fire! be thou cool, and (a means of) safety for Abraham!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They wished to entrap him, but We made them greater losers.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They desired to outwit him; so We made them the worse losers,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And they intended to do him an evil, but We made them the worst losers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And they wanted to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They planned to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They had sought to do evil to him, but We caused them to be the worst losers,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And they wanted to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And they wished to set a snare for him, but We made them the greater losers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They plotted to harm him, but We made them the biggest losers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They sought to outwit him, but We made them the worst of losers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And they intended for him harm, but We made them the greatest losers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They had devised an evil plan (against Abraham), but We turned it into failure."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And they desired a war on him, but We made them the greatest losers.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They had sought to do him harm, but We frustrated them.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the ones that lost most!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And Abraham indeed was of his inducement,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed Ibrahim is from his (Nooh’s) group.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Of his party was also Abraham;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And verily of his sect was Ibrahim.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And, verily, among those who followed his [Nuh's (Noah)] way (Islamic Monotheism) was Ibrahim (Abraham).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Of his kind was Abraham.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham was on the self-same way (as Noah).

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And verily, among those who followed his way was Ibrahim.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And lo! of his persuasion verily was Abraham

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed Abraham was among his followers,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Of his party was Abraham.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham was one of his followers.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And most surely Ibrahim followed his way.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham was of the same faith:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Verily among those who followed his Way was Abraham.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When he came to his Lord with a heart compliant,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: When he came to his Lord, with a sound heart. (Free from falsehood).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: when he came unto his Lord with a pure heart,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Recall what time he came Unto his lord with a heart whole.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When he came to his Lord with a pure heart [attached to Allah Alone and none else, worshipping none but Allah Alone true Islamic Monotheism, pure from the filth of polytheism].

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When he came to his Lord with a pure heart,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When he came to his Lord with a Salim heart.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When he came unto his Lord with a whole heart;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: when he came to his Lord with a sound heart [untainted by sin].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Remember when) he came to his Lord with a pure heart;

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He turned to his Lord with a sound heart

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When he came to his Lord with a free heart,

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Ith jaa rabbahu biqalbin saleemin

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: he came to his Lord with a sound heart.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! he approached his Lord with a sound heart.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What is this you worship?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: When he said to his father (paternal uncle) and his people, “What do you worship?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: when he said to his father and his folk, 'What do you serve?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Recall what time he said Unto his father and his people: What is it that ye worship?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When he said to his father and to his people: "What is it that which you worship?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said to his father and his people, “What are you worshiping?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and said to his father and his people: “Whom do you worship?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When he said to his father and to his people: "What is it that which you worship"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When he said unto his father and his folk: What is it that ye worship?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people, ‘What is it that you are worshiping?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and when he said to his father and to his nation: 'What do you worship?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and asked his father and his people, "What is that you worship?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When he said to his father and his people: What is it that you worship?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Ith qala liabeehi waqawmihi matha taAAbudoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "Behold!" he said to his father and to his people, "What are these that you worship?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! he said to his father and to his people, "What is that which ye worship?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Why do you solicit false gods instead of God?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “What! You desire, through fabrication, Gods other than Allah?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Is it a calumny, gods apart from God, that you desire?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Is it a falsehood-god beside Allah - that ye desire?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Is it a falsehood aliha (gods) other than Allah that you seek?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Is it falsified gods, instead of God, that you want?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Is it false deities that you want to serve rather than Allah?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Is it a falsehood -- gods other than Allah -- that you desire"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Is it a falsehood - gods beside Allah - that ye desire?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Is it a lie, gods other than Allah, that you desire?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: It is falsehood that you desire gods other than Allah!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allah you desire?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Do you want to worship false idols as your lords besides God?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: A lie-- gods besides Allah-- do you desire?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Aifkan alihatan doona Allahi tureedoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Would you serve false deities instead of God?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Is it a falsehood- gods other than Allah- that ye desire?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: What do you imagine the Lord of the worlds to be?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “So what do you assume regarding the Lord Of The Creation?” (That He will not punish you?)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: What think you then of the Lord of all Being?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: what, then, is your opinion of the Lord of the worlds?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Then what do you think about the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns, and all that exists)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So what is your opinion about the Lord of the Worlds?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: What do you think of the Lord of the whole Universe?”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Then what think you about the Lord of the all that exists"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: What then is your opinion of the Lord of the Worlds?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then what is your idea about the Lord of all the worlds?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: What do you think of the Lord of the Worlds'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: What do you think about the Lord of the Universe?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: What is then your idea about the Lord of the worlds?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Fama thannukum birabbi alAAalameena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: What do you think of the Lord of the Worlds?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Then what is your idea about the Lord of the worlds?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then he looked up at the stars (they worshipped),

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He then shot a glance at the stars.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And he cast a glance at the stars,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he glanced a glance on the stars.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then he cast a glance at the stars (to deceive them),

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then he took a glance at the stars.

translation.author: Maududi

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then he cast a glance at the stars,

translation.text: And he glanced a glance at the stars

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then he made an observation of the stars

translation.author: Saheeh International

translation.text: He looked up at the stars.

translation.text: Then did he cast a glance at the Stars.

translation.text: And said: "I am sick (of what you worship)!"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He then said, “I feel sick (of you)!”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and he said, 'Surely I am sick.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And he said: verily I am about to be sick.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And he said: "Verily, I am sick (with plague. He did this trick to remain in their temple of idols to destroy them and not to accompany them to the pagan's feast)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And said, “I am sick.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and said: “I am sick.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And he said: "Verily, I am sick."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then said: Lo! I feel sick!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and said, ‘Indeed I am sick!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and said: 'Surely, I am sick (of what you worship)'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and said, "I am sick!"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then he said: Surely I am sick (of your worshipping these).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And said, "I am sick,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: But they went away from him, turning their backs.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: So they departed from him turning their backs.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So they turned away from him, and departed (for fear of the disease).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But they turned their backs on him, and went away.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: So turning their backs, they went away from him.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So they turned away from him and departed.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But they turned their backs and went away from him.

translation.text: All the people turned away from him

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So they went away from him, turning back.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Fatawallaw AAanhu mudbireena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: so they turned their backs on him and went off.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So they turned away from him, and departed.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then he turned towards their gods and said: "Why do you not eat (of these offerings)?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He then sneaked upon their deities and said, “Do you not eat?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then he turned to their gods, and said, 'What do you eat?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he slipped Unto their gods and said: eat ye not

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then he turned to their aliha (gods) and said: "Will you not eat (of the offering before you)?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then he turned to their gods, and said, “will you not eat?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then he went quietly to the (temple of the deities) and said: “What is the matter with you, why do you not eat?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then he turned to their gods and said: "Will you not eat"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then turned he to their gods and said: Will ye not eat?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then he stole away to their gods and said, ‘Will you not eat?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then he turned to their gods, and said: 'What do you eat?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and he turned to their idols and asked them, "Do you eat?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then he turned aside to their gods secretly and said: What! do you not eat?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Faragha ila alihatihim faqala ala takuloona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then did he turn to their gods and said, "will ye not eat (of the offerings before you)?...

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “What is the matter with you, that you do not say anything?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: What ails you, that you speak not?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: What aileth ye that ye speak not?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "What is the matter with you that you speak not?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: What is it with you, that you do not speak?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: What is the matter with you, why do you not speak?”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "What is the matter with you that you speak not"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: What aileth you that ye speak not?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Why do you not speak?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: What is the matter with you, that you do not speak'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Why do you not speak?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: What is the matter with you that you do not speak?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Ma lakum la tantiqoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: What is the matter with you that you do not speak?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "What is the matter with you that ye speak not (intelligently)?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then he started striking them down with his right hand.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He then began striking them with his right hand, unseen by the people.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And he turned upon them smiting them with his right hand.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he slipped Unto them striking them with the right hand.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then he turned upon them, striking (them) with (his) right hand.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then he turned on them, striking with his right hand.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then he turned upon them, striking (them) with (his) right hand.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then he attacked them, striking with his right hand.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then he attacked them, striking forcefully.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And he turned upon them striking them with the right hand.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He struck them with his right hand.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then he turned against them secretly, smiting them with the right hand.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Faragha AAalayhim darban bialyameeni

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: then he turned on them, striking them down with his right hand.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then did he turn upon them, striking (them) with the right hand.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So the people descended upon him.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So the disbelievers came running towards him.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then came the others to him hastening.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then they advanced toward him, hastening.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then they (the worshippers of idols) came, towards him, hastening.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And they came running towards him.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: whereupon people came to him running.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then they came hastily towards him.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (his people) came toward him, hastening.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They came running towards him.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Thereafter they (the people) came to him in haste.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then the people came toward him, hastening.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Thereupon the people came running to him.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So they (people) advanced towards him, hastening.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Faaqbaloo ilayhi yaziffoona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: His people came rushing towards him,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then came (the worshippers) with hurried steps, and faced (him).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Why do you worship these you carve yourselves," he asked,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Do you serve what you hew,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: worship ye that which carve.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He said: "Worship you that which you (yourselves) carve?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Do you worship what you carve?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said to them: “Do you worship what you yourselves have carved with your own hands

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Worship you that which you (yourselves) carve"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Worship ye that which ye yourselves do carve

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Do you worship what you have yourselves carved,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'Do you worship what you, yourselves have carved

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "How can you worship what you yourselves have carved

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Said he: What! do you worship what you hew out?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: but he said, "How can you worship things you carve with your own hands,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Worship ye that which ye have (yourselves) carved?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "When God has created you and what you make?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Whereas Allah has created you and your actions?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and God created you and what you make?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Whereas Allah hath created you and that which ye make?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "While Allah has created you and what you make!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When God created you, and what you manufacture?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: while it is Allah Who has created you and all that you make?”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "While Allah has created you and what you make!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When Allah hath created you and what ye make?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: when Allah has created you and whatever you make?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: when it is Allah who created you and all that you do'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: While Allah created you and that which you do?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: even though God created both you and that which you have made?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Allah has created you and what you make.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: WaAllahu khalaqakum wama taAAmaloona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: when it is God who has created you and all your handiwork?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "But Allah has created you and your handwork!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Build a pyre for him and throw him into the raging fire."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Construct a building (furnace) for him, and then cast him in the blazing fire!”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Build him a building, and cast him into the furnace!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said. build for him a building and cast him into the flaming fire.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
