He (Allah) answered: "As for him who disbelieves, I shall leave him in contentment for a while, then I shall compel him to the torment of the Fire, and worst indeed is that destination!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Abraham prayed: My Lord! Make this a region of security and bestow upon its people fruits, such of them as believe in Allah and the Last Day, He answered: As for him who disbelieveth, I shall leave him in contentment for a while, then I shall compel him to the doom of Fire - a hapless journey's end!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And when Abraham said, ‘My Lord, make this a secure town, and provide its people with fruits—such of them as have faith in Allah and the Last Day,’ He said, ‘As for him who is faithless, I will provide for him [too] for a short time, then I will shove him toward the punishment of the Fire and it is an evil destination.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Abraham said: 'My Lord, make this country safe and provide its inhabitants whosoever of them believes in Allah and the Last Day with fruits' He said: 'And whosoever disbelieves, to him I shall give enjoyment for a while. Then I shall compel him to the punishment of the Fire, how evil an arrival'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this a secure city and provide its people with fruits - whoever of them believes in Allah and the Last Day." [Allah] said. "And whoever disbelieves - I will grant him enjoyment for a little; then I will force him to the punishment of the Fire, and wretched is the destination."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Abraham prayed to the Lord saying, "Lord, make this town a place of security and provide those in the town who believe in God and the Day of Judgement, with plenty," God replied, "I shall allow those who hide the truth to enjoy themselves for a while. Then I shall drive them into the torment of hell fire, a terrible destination!"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Ibrahim said: My Lord, make it a secure town and provide its people with fruits, such of them as believe in Allah and the last day. He said: And whoever disbelieves, I will grant him enjoyment for a short while, then I will drive him to the chastisement of the fire; and it is an evil destination.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And when Abraham prayed, "My Lord, make this city a city of peace, and provide its inhabitants with fruits, such of them as believe in God and the Last Day." God said, "As for those who deny the truth, I will grant them benefits for a short while and then subject them to the punishment of the Fire -- an evil destination."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And remember Abraham said: "My Lord, make this a City of Peace, and feed its people with fruits,-such of them as believe in Allah and the Last Day." He said: "(Yea), and such as reject Faith,-for a while will I grant them their pleasure, but will soon drive them to the torment of Fire,- an evil destination (indeed)!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And when Abraham was raising the plinth of the House with Ishmael, (he prayed): "Accept this from us, O Lord, for You hear and know everything;

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim was raising the foundations of the House, along with Ismail; (saying), “Our Lord! Accept it from us; indeed You only are the All Hearing, the All Knowing.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Abraham, and Ishmael with him, raised up the foundations of the House: 'Our Lord, receive this from us; Thou art the All-hearing, the All-knowing;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Ibrahim was raising the foundation of the House and also Ismai'l, praying: our Lord! accept of us; verily Thou! Thou art the Hearer, the Knower!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) and (his son) Isma'il (Ishmael) were raising the foundations of the House (the Ka'bah at Makkah), (saying), "Our Lord! Accept (this service) from us. Verily! You are the All-Hearer, the All-Knower."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: As Abraham raises the foundations of the House, together with Ishmael, “Our Lord, accept it from us, You are the Hearer, the Knower.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And remember that when Abraham and Ishmael were raising the walls of the House, they prayed, "Lord, accept this service from us; You are All-Hearing and All-Knowing.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim and (his son) Isma`il were raising the foundations of the House (the Ka`bah at Makkah), (saying), "Our Lord! Accept (this service) from us. Verily, You are the Hearer, the Knower."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Abraham and Ishmael were raising the foundations of the House, (Abraham prayed): Our Lord! Accept from us (this duty). Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Hearer, the Knower.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: As Abraham raised the foundations of the House with Ishmael, [they prayed]: ‘Our Lord, accept it from us! Indeed You are the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Abraham and Ishmael raised the foundations of the House (supplicating): 'O our Lord, accept this from us, You are the Hearer, the Knower.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when Abraham was raising the foundations of the House and [with him] Ishmael, [saying], "Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: While Abraham and Ishmael were raising the foundation of the house, they prayed, "Lord, accept our labor. You are All-hearing and All-knowing.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Ibrahim and Ismail raised the foundations of the House: Our Lord! accept from us; surely Thou art the Hearing, the Knowing:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And when Abraham and Ishmael were laying the foundations of the House, [they prayed], "Our Lord, accept this from us; for You are All Hearing, All Knowing.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And remember Abraham and Isma'il raised the foundations of the House (With this prayer): "Our Lord! Accept (this service) from us: For Thou art the All-Hearing, the All-knowing.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And make us submit, O Lord, to Your will, and our progeny a people submissive to You. Teach us the way of worship and forgive our trespasses, for You are compassionate and merciful;

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Our Lord! And make us submissive towards you and from our offspring a nation obedient to You – and show us the ways of our worship, and incline towards us with Your mercy; indeed You only are the Most Acceptor of Repentance, the Most Merciful.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and, our Lord, make us submissive to Thee, and of our seed a nation submissive to Thee; and show us our holy rites, and turn towards us; surely Thou turnest, and art All-compassionate;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Our Lord! make us twain submissive unto Thee, and of our progeny community submissive unto Thee, and show us our rites, and relent toward us! verily Thou! Thou art the Relentant, the Merciful!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Our Lord! And make us submissive unto You and of our offspring a nation submissive unto You, and show us our Manasik (all the ceremonies of pilgrimage - Hajj and 'Umrah, etc.), and accept our repentance. Truly, You are the One Who accepts repentance, the Most Merciful.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Our Lord, and make us submissive to You, and from our descendants a community submissive to You. And show us our rites, and accept our repentance. You are the Acceptor of Repentance, the Merciful.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Lord, make us Your Muslims (submissive servants) and also raise from our offspring a community which should be Muslim (submissive to Your Will). Show us the ways of Your worship and forbear our shortcomings: You are Forgiving and Merciful.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Our Lord! And make us submissive unto You and of our offspring a nation submissive unto You, and show us our Manasik, and accept our repentance. Truly, You are the One Who accepts repentance, the Most Merciful.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Our Lord! And make us submissive unto Thee and of our seed a nation submissive unto Thee, and show us our ways of worship, and relent toward us. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Relenting, the Merciful.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Our Lord, make us submissive to You, and [raise] from our progeny a nation submissive to You, and show us our rites [of worship], and turn to us clemently. Indeed You are the All-clement, the All-merciful.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Our Lord, make us both submissive to You, and of our descendants a submissive nation to You. Show us our rites and accept us; You are the Receiver of Repentance, the Merciful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Our Lord, and make us Muslims [in submission] to You and from our descendants a Muslim nation [in submission] to You. And show us our rites and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Lord, make us good Muslims (one who submits himself to God) and from our descendants make a good Muslim nation. Teach us the rules of worship and accept our repentance; You are All-forgiving and All-merciful.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Our Lord! and make us both submissive to Thee and (raise) from our offspring a nation submitting to Thee, and show us our ways of devotion and turn to us (mercifully), surely Thou art the Oft-returning (to mercy), the Merciful.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Rabbana waijAAalna muslimayni laka wamin thurriyyatina ommatan muslimatan laka waarina manasikana watub AAalayna innaka anta alttawwabu alrraheemu

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Lord, make us submissive to You; make of our descendants a nation that will submit to You. Teach us our rites of worship and turn to us with mercy; You are the Forgiving One and the Merciful.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Our Lord! make of us Muslims, bowing to Thy (Will), and of our progeny a people Muslim, bowing to Thy (will); and show us our place for the celebration of (due) rites; and turn unto us (in Mercy); for Thou art the Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And send to them, O Lord, an apostle from among them to impart Your messages to them, and teach them the Book and the wisdom, and correct them in every way; for indeed You are mighty and wise.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Our Lord! And send towards them a Noble Messenger, from amongst them, to recite to them Your verses, and to instruct them in Your Book and sound wisdom*, and to fully purify them; indeed You only are the Almighty, the Wise.” (The traditions of the Holy Prophet – sunnah and hadith – are called wisdom.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and, our Lord, do Thou send among them a Messenger, one of them, who shall recite to them Thy signs, and teach them the Book and the Wisdom, and purify them; Thou art the All-mighty, the All-wise.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Our Lord! raise up unto them an apostle from among them, who shall recite unto them Thy revelations, and shall teach them the Book and wisdom, and shall cleanse them. Verily Thou! Thou art the Mighty, the Wise.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Our Lord! Send amongst them a Messenger of their own (and indeed Allah answered their invocation by sending Muhammad Peace be upon him), who shall recite unto them Your Verses and instruct them in the Book (this Quran) and Al-Hikmah (full knowledge of the Islamic laws and jurisprudence or wisdom or Prophethood, etc.), and sanctify them. Verily! You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Our Lord, and raise up among them a messenger, of themselves, who will recite to them Your revelations, and teach them the Book and wisdom, and purify them. You are the Almighty, the Wise.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Lord, raise up from among them a Messenger who shall recite Your Revelations to them and teach them the Book and Wisdom and purify their lives. You art All-Powerful and AllWise".

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Our Lord! Send amongst them a Messenger of their own, who shall recite unto them Your verses and instruct them in the Book (this Qur'an), and purify them. Verily, You are the Mighty, the Wise."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Our Lord! And raise up in their midst a messenger from among them who shall recite unto them Thy revelations, and shall instruct them in the Scripture and in wisdom and shall make them grow. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Mighty, Wise.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Our Lord, raise amongst them an apostle from among them, who will recite to them Your signs and teach them the Book and wisdom and purify them. Indeed You are the All-mighty, the All-wise.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Our Lord, send among them a Messenger from them who shall recite to them Your verses and teach them the Book and wisdom, and purify them; You are the Mighty, the Wise'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Our Lord, and send among them a messenger from themselves who will recite to them Your verses and teach them the Book and wisdom and purify them. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Lord, send to them (our descendants) a Messenger of their own who will recite to them Your revelations, teach them the Book, give them wisdom, and purify them. You alone are the Majestic and the Most Wise."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Our Lord! and raise up in them an Apostle from among them who shall recite to them Thy communications and teach them the Book and the wisdom, and purify them; surely Thou art the Mighty, the Wise.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Rabbana waibAAath feehim rasoolan minhum yatloo AAalayhim ayatika wayuAAallimuhumu alkitaba waalhikmata wayuzakkeehim innaka anta alAAazeezu alhakeemu

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Our Lord, send forth to them a messenger of their own to recite Your revelations to them, to teach them the Scripture and wisdom, and purify them. You are the Mighty, the Wise One."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Our Lord! send amongst them a Messenger of their own, who shall rehearse Thy Signs to them and instruct them in scripture and wisdom, and sanctify them: For Thou art the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Who will turn away from the creed of Abraham but one dull of soul? We made him the chosen one here in the world, and one of the best in the world to come,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And who will renounce the religion of Ibrahim except him who is a fool at heart? We indeed chose him (Ibrahim) in this world; and indeed in the Hereafter he is among those worthy of being closest to Us.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Who therefore shrinks from the religion of Abraham, except he be foolish-minded? Indeed, We chose him in the present world, and in the world to come he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And who shall be averse from the faith of Ibrahim, save one who befooleth his soul! And assuredly We chose him in this World, and verily he in the Hereafter shall be of the righteous.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And who turns away from the religion of Ibrahim (Abraham) (i.e. Islamic Monotheism) except him who befools himself? Truly, We chose him in this world and verily, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Who would forsake the religion of Abraham, except he who fools himself? We chose him in this world, and in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Now, who else can have aversion to the way of Abraham but the one who has debased himself with folly and ignorance? Abraham was the man whom We chose for Our service in this world, and in the Next World he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And who turns away from the religion of Ibrahim (i.e. Islamic Monotheism) except him who fools himself Truly, We chose him in this world and verily, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And who forsaketh the religion of Abraham save him who befooleth himself? Verily We chose him in the world, and lo! in the Hereafter he is among the righteous.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And who will [ever] forsake Abraham’s creed except one who debases himself? We certainly chose him in the [present] world, and in the Hereafter he will indeed be among the Righteous.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And who has no desire for the religion of Abraham, except he who fooled himself? We chose him in this world, and in the Everlasting world, he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And who would be averse to the religion of Abraham except one who makes a fool of himself. And We had chosen him in this world, and indeed he, in the Hereafter, will be among the righteous.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: No one turns away from Abraham's Tradition except one who makes a fool of himself. To Abraham We have granted distinction in this world and in the life hereafter he will be among the righteous ones.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And who forsakes the religion of Ibrahim but he who makes himself a fool, and most certainly We chose him in this world, and in the hereafter he is most surely among the righteous.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Who but a foolish man would turn away from the religion of Abraham? We chose him in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And who turns away from the religion of Abraham but such as debase their souls with folly? Him We chose and rendered pure in this world: And he will be in the Hereafter in the ranks of the Righteous.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (For) when his Lord said to him: "Obey," he replied: "I submit to the Lord of all the worlds."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When his Lord said to him, 'Surrender,' he said, 'I have surrendered me to the Lord of all Being.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Recall what time his Lord said unto him: submit, he said: I submit to the Lord of the Worlds.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When his Lord said to him, "Submit (i.e. be a Muslim)!" He said, "I have submitted myself (as a Muslim) to the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When his Lord said to him, “Submit!” He said, “I have submitted to the Lord of the Worlds.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When his Lord said to him, "Surrender," he promptly responded, "I have surrendered to the Lord of the Universe (and become a Muslim)."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When his Lord said to him, "Submit (i.e. be a Muslim)!" He said, "I have submitted myself (as a Muslim) to the Lord of the `Alamin (mankind, Jinn and all that exists)."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When his Lord said unto him: Surrender! he said: I have surrendered to the Lord of the Worlds.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When his Lord said to him, ‘Submit,’ he said, ‘I submit to the Lord of all the worlds.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When his Lord said to him: 'Submit' he answered: 'I have submitted to the Lord of the Worlds'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When his Lord said to him, "Submit", he said "I have submitted [in Islam] to the Lord of the worlds."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When God commanded Abraham to submit, he replied, "I have submitted myself to the Will of the Lord of the universe."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When his Lord said to him, Be a Muslim, he said: I submit myself to the Lord of the worlds.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When his Lord said to him, "Surrender!" he responded, "I have surrendered to the Lord of the Universe,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! his Lord said to him: "Bow (thy will to Me):" He said: "I bow (my will) to the Lord and Cherisher of the Universe."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And Abraham left this legacy to his sons, and to Jacob, and said: "O my sons, God has chosen this as the faith for you. Do not die but as those who have submitted (to God)."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And Ibrahim willed the same religion upon his sons, and also did Yaqub (Jacob); (saying), “O my sons – indeed Allah has chosen this religion for you; therefore do not die except as Muslims (those who submit to Him).”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Abraham charged his sons with this and Jacob likewise: 'My sons, God has chosen for you the religion; see that you die not save in surrender.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Ibrahim enjoined his sons the same and did Ya'qub also, saying: O my sons! verily Allah hath chosen for you the religion, so die not except ye be Muslims.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And this (submission to Allah, Islam) was enjoined by Ibrahim (Abraham) upon his sons and by Ya'qub (Jacob), (saying), "O my sons! Allah has chosen for you the (true) religion, then die not except in the Faith of Islam (as Muslims - Islamic Monotheism)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Abraham exhorted his sons, and Jacob, “O my sons, God has chosen this religion for you, so do not die unless you have submitted.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He also enjoined on his children to follow the same way. Jacob also did the same and his last will to his sons was, "O my children, Allah has chosen the same way of life for you. Hence remain Muslims up to your last breath."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And this (submission to Allah, Islam) was enjoined by Ibrahim (Abraham) upon his sons and by Ya`qub (Jacob) (saying), "O my sons! Allah has chosen for you the (true) religion, then die not except as Muslims."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The same did Abraham enjoin upon his sons, and also Jacob, (saying): O my sons! Lo! Allah hath chosen for you the (true) religion; therefore die not save as men who have surrendered (unto Him).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Abraham enjoined this [creed] upon his children, and [so did] Jacob, [saying], ‘My children! Allah has indeed chosen this religion for you; so do not die except as those who have surrendered themselves [to Allah].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Abraham charged his children with this, and so did Jacob, saying: 'My sons, Allah has chosen for you the religion. Do not die except being submissive (Muslims)'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Abraham instructed his sons [to do the same] and [so did] Jacob, [saying], "O my sons, indeed Allah has chosen for you this religion, so do not die except while you are Muslims."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham left this legacy to his sons and, in turn, so did Jacob saying, "God has chosen this religion for you. You must not leave this world unless you are a Muslim (submitted to the will of the Lord of the Universe)."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the same did Ibrahim enjoin on his sons and (so did) Yaqoub. O my sons! surely Allah has chosen for you (this) faith, therefore die not unless you are Muslims.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and Abraham enjoined his sons to do the same, as did Jacob, "My sons, God has chosen this religion for you; so do not let death overtake you, except when you are in a state of submission."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And this was the legacy that Abraham left to his sons, and so did Jacob; "Oh my sons! Allah hath chosen the Faith for you; then die not except in the Faith of Islam."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When We chose the site of the House for Abraham (We said:) "Associate no one with Me, and clean My House for those who will circumambulate it, stand (in reverence), and bow in homage.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember when We showed Ibrahim the right place of the Sacred House (mosque) and commanded that, “Do not ascribe anything as a partner to Me, and keep My House clean for those who encircle it and those who stay in it (for worship) and those who bow and prostrate.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We settled for Abraham the place of the House: 'Thou shall not associate with Me anything. And do thou purify My House for those that shall go about it and those that stand, for those that bow and prostrate themselves;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We settled Ibrahim in the place of the House, Saying: associate not thou with Me aught, and purify My House for these who circumambulate and those who stand up and those who bow and make prostration.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We showed Ibrahim (Abraham) the site of the (Sacred) House (the Ka'bah at Makkah) (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me, [La ilaha ill-Allah (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah Islamic Monotheism], and sanctify My House for those who circumambulate it, and those who stand up for prayer, and those who bow (submit themselves with humility and obedience to Allah), and make prostration (in prayer, etc.);"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We showed Abraham the location of the House: “Do not associate anything with Me; and purify My House for those who circle around, and those who stand to pray, and those who kneel and prostrate.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Call to mind when We assigned to Abraham the site of the House (Kabah), directing him: "Do not associate aught with Me" and "Keep My House pure for those who walk around it, and for those who stand and who bow down and who prostrate themselves (in worship),

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when We showed Ibrahim the site of the House (saying): "Associate not anything with Me, and sanctify My House for those who circumambulate it, and those who stand up (for prayer), and those who bow and make prostration (in prayer);"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (remember) when We prepared for Abraham the place of the (holy) House, saying: Ascribe thou no thing as partner unto Me, and purify My House for those who make the round (thereof) and those who stand and those who bow and make prostration.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When We settled for Abraham the site of the House [saying], Do not ascribe any partners to Me, and purify My House for those who circle around it, and those who stand [in it for prayer], and those who bow and prostrate themselves.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when We settled for Abraham (and Ishmael) the place of the Holy Mosque, (We said): 'You shall not associate with Me anything. Purify My House for those who circumambulate it and those who stand, for those who bow and prostrate.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When We prepared for Abraham the place to build the Sacred House, We told him not to consider anything equal to Me and to keep the House clean for those walking around it, those standing, bowing down, and prostrating in prayer.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We assigned to Ibrahim the place of the House, saying: Do not associate with Me aught, and purify My House for those who make the circuit and stand to pray and bow and prostrate themselves.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We assigned to Abraham the site of the House, saying, "Do not associate with Me anything and purify My House for those who circumambulate [the Kabah] and those who stand upright, and those who bow and prostrate themselves."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! We gave the site, to Abraham, of the (Sacred) House, (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or stand up, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Announce the Pilgrimage to the people. They will come to you on foot and riding along distant roads on lean and slender beasts,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “And publicly announce the pilgrimage to all people – they will come to you, on foot and on every lean she-camel, coming from every far distant journey.” (The announcement by Prophet Ibrahim reached each and every soul.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and proclaim among men the Pilgrimage, and they shall come unto thee on foot and upon every lean beast, they shall come from every deep ravine

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And proclaim thou among mankind the pilgrimage; they shall come unto thee on foot and on any lean mount, coming from every deep defile.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And proclaim to mankind the Hajj (pilgrimage). They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel, they will come from every deep and distant (wide) mountain highway (to perform Hajj).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And announce the pilgrimage to humanity. They will come to you on foot, and on every transport. They will come from every distant point.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and publicly proclaim Pilgrimage for all mankind so that they come to you on foot and mounted on lean camels from every distant point

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And proclaim to mankind the Hajj (pilgrimage). They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel, they will come from every Fajj `Amiq.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And proclaim unto mankind the pilgrimage. They will come unto thee on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every deep ravine,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And proclaim the Hajj to all the people: they will come to you on foot and on lean camels, coming from distant places,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Proclaim the pilgrimage to the people. They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel, they shall come from every deep ravine;

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And proclaim to the people the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (We commanded Abraham), "Call people for hajj - an act of worship accomplished by visiting the sacred sites in Mecca." They will come on foot and on lean camels from all the distant quarters

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And proclaim among men the Pilgrimage: they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel, coming from every remote path,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Call mankind to the Pilgrimage. They will come to you, on foot, and on every kind of lean camel, by every distant track

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "And proclaim the Pilgrimage among men: they will come to thee on foot and (mounted) on every kind of camel, lean on account of journeys through deep and distant mountain highways;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember when Abraham prayed: "O Lord, make this a city of peace, and preserve me and my progeny from worshipping idols:

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember when Ibrahim prayed, “O my Lord! Make this town (Mecca) a safe one, and safeguard me and my sons from worshipping idols.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Abraham said, 'My Lord, make this land secure, and turn me and my sons away from serving idols;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Ibrahim said: my Lord! make this City secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping the idols.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "O my Lord! Make this city (Makkah) one of peace and security, and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Recall that Abraham said, “O my Lord, make this land peaceful, and keep me and my sons from worshiping idols.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And call to mind when Abraham prayed: "My Lord! Make this city secure, and keep me and my sons away from worshipping the idols.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim said: "O my Lord! Make this city (Makkah) one of peace and security, and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Abraham said: My Lord! Make safe this territory, and preserve me and my sons from serving idols.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Abraham said, ‘My Lord! Make this city a sanctuary, and save me and my children from worshiping idols.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Abraham said: 'My Lord, make this a land secure. Turn me and my children away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this city [Makkah] secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), consider when Abraham prayed, "Lord, make this (Mecca) a peaceful territory and save me and my offspring from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Ibrahim said: My Lord! make this city secure, and save me and my sons from worshipping idols:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: [Remember] when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this a city of peace and help me and my children to keep away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Remember Abraham said: "O my Lord! make this city one of peace and security: and preserve me and my sons from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Many a man have they led astray, O Lord. So he who follows me is truly of me; but as for him who disobeys me, surely You are forgiving and kind.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O my Lord! The idols have led many people astray; so whoever followed me, is indeed mine; and whoever disobeyed me – then indeed You are Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: my Lord, they have led astray many men. Then whoso follows me belongs to me; and whoso rebels against me, surely Thou art All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: My Lord! they have sent astray many among mankind; whosoever followeth me, verily he is of me; and whosoever disobeyeth me, then verily Thou art Forgiving, Merciful.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O my Lord! They have indeed led astray many among mankind. But whoso follows me, he verily is of me. And whoso disobeys me, - still You are indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “My Lord, they have led many people astray. Whoever follows me belongs with me; and whoever disobeys me—You are Forgiving and Merciful.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: My Lord! They have caused many people to go astray. Now, if anyone follows my way, he is from me; and if anyone follows a way opposed to mine, then surely You are Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O my Lord! They have indeed led astray many among mankind. But whoso follows me, he verily, is of me. And whoso disobeys me, still You are indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: My Lord! Lo! they have led many of mankind astray. But whoso followeth me, he verily is of me. And whoso disobeyeth me - Still Thou art Forgiving, Merciful.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: My Lord! Indeed they have misled many people. So whoever follows me indeed belongs to me, and as for those who disobey me, well, You are indeed all-forgiving, all-merciful.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: My Lord they have led many people astray. Whosoever follows me belongs to me. Whosoever rebels against me, You are surely Forgiving, the MostMerciful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: My Lord, indeed they have led astray many among the people. So whoever follows me - then he is of me; and whoever disobeys me - indeed, You are [yet] Forgiving and Merciful.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Lord, the idols have misled many people. Whoever follows me is my friend. As for those who disobey, You are certainly All-forgiving and All-merciful.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: My Lord! surely they have led many men astray; then whoever follows me, he is surely of me, and whoever disobeys me, Thou surely art Forgiving, Merciful:

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Rabbi innahunna adlalna katheeran mina alnnasi faman tabiAAanee fainnahu minnee waman AAasanee fainnaka ghafoorun raheemun

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: My Lord, they have led so many men astray! Anyone who follows me is with me, but if anyone turns against me, You are surely forgiving and merciful.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O my Lord! they have indeed led astray many among mankind; He then who follows my (ways) is of me, and he that disobeys me,- but Thou art indeed Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: I have settled some of my children, O Lord, in a barren valley near Your sacred House, so that, O our Lord, they may be constant in devotion. So put in the hearts of men some kindness for them, and provide fruits for them: They may haply be grateful.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O our Lord! I have settled some of my descendants in a valley having no cultivation, near Your Sacred House – O our Lord! So that they may keep the prayer established, therefore incline some hearts of men towards them, and provide them fruits to eat – perhaps they may be thankful.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Our Lord, I have made some of my seed to dwell in a valley where is no sown land by Thy Holy House; Our Lord, let them perform the prayer, and make hearts of men yearn towards them, and provide them with fruits; haply they will be thankful.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Our Lord! verily have caused some of my progeny to dwell in a valley uncultivable near Thy Sacred House, Our Lord! in order that they may establish prayer; make Thou therefore the hearts of some of mankind to Yearn toward them, and provide them Thou With fruits, haply they may give thanks.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring to dwell in an uncultivable valley by Your Sacred House (the Ka'bah at Makkah); in order, O our Lord, that they may perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), so fill some hearts among men with love towards them, and (O Allah) provide them with fruits so that they may give thanks.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “Our Lord, I have settled some of my offspring in a valley of no vegetation, by Your Sacred House, our Lord, so that they may perform the prayers. So make the hearts of some people incline towards them, and provide them with fruits, that they may be thankful.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: "Our Lord! I have made some of my offspring settle in a barren valley near Your Sacred House! Our Lord! I did so that they may establish Prayer. So make the hearts of people affectionately inclined to them, and provide them with fruits for their sustenance that they may give thanks.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring dwell in an uncultivable valley by Your Sacred House in order, O our Lord, that they may perform Salah. So fill some hearts among men with love towards them, and (O Allah) provide them with fruits so that they may give thanks.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Our Lord! Lo! I have settled some of my posterity in an uncultivable valley near unto Thy holy House, our Lord! that they may establish proper worship; so incline some hearts of men that they may yearn toward them, and provide Thou them with fruits in order that they may be thankful.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Our Lord! I have settled part of my descendants in a barren valley, by Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may maintain the prayer. So make the hearts of a part of the people fond of them, and provide them with fruits, so that they may give thanks.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Our Lord, I have settled some of my offspring in a barren valley near Your Holy House; our Lord, in order that they establish the prayer. Make the hearts of people yearn towards them, and provide them with fruits, in order that they are thankful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits that they might be grateful.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: "Lord, I have settled some of my offspring in a barren valley near your Sacred House so that they could be steadfast in prayer. Lord, fill the hearts of the people with love for them and produce fruits for their sustenance so that they may give thanks.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O our Lord! surely I have settled a part of my offspring in a valley unproductive of fruit near Thy Sacred House, our Lord! that they may keep up prayer; therefore make the hearts of some people yearn towards them and provide them with fruits; haply they may be grateful:

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Rabbana innee askantu min thurriyyatee biwadin ghayri thee zarAAin AAinda baytika almuharrami rabbana liyuqeemoo alssalata faijAAal afidatan mina alnnasi tahwee ilayhim waorzuqhum mina alththamarati laAAallahum yashkuroona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: O Lord! I have settled some of my offspring in an uncultivable valley near Your Sacred House, Lord, so that they might establish their prayers. So, make people's hearts incline towards them and provide them with fruits so that they may be grateful.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring to dwell in a valley without cultivation, by Thy Sacred House; in order, O our Lord, that they may establish regular Prayer: so fill the hearts of some among men with love towards them, and feed them with fruits: so that they may give thanks.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O Lord, You have knowledge of what we hide and what we reveal, for nothing on the earth or in the skies is hidden from God.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O our Lord! You know what we hide and what we disclose; and nothing is hidden from Allah, neither in the earth nor in the heavens.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Our Lord, Thou knowest what we keep secret and what we publish; from God nothing whatever is hidden in earth and heaven.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Our Lord! verily Thou knowest that which We conceal and that which We make known; and not of aught is concealed from Allah in the earth or in the heaven.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O our Lord! Certainly, You know what we conceal and what we reveal. Nothing on the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “Our Lord, You know what we conceal and what we reveal. And nothing is hidden from God, on earth or in the heaven.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Our Lord! Surely You know all that we conceal and all that we reveal, and nothing in the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O our Lord! Certainly, You know what we conceal and what we reveal. Nothing on the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Our Lord! Lo! Thou knowest that which we hide and that which we proclaim. Nothing in the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Our Lord! Indeed You know whatever we hide and whatever we disclose, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the sky.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Our Lord, You have knowledge of all that we hide and all that we reveal; nothing in heaven or earth is hidden from Allah.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the heaven.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Lord, You know all that we conceal or reveal. Nothing in the heavens or the earth is hidden from God.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O our Lord! Surely Thou knowest what we hide and what we make public, and nothing in the earth nor any thing in heaven is hidden from Allah:

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Rabbana innaka taAAlamu ma nukhfee wama nuAAlinu wama yakhfa AAala Allahi min shayin fee alardi wala fee alssamai

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Lord, You have knowledge of all that we hide and all that we reveal: nothing in heaven or on earth is hidden from God.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O our Lord! truly Thou dost know what we conceal and what we reveal: for nothing whatever is hidden from Allah, whether on earth or in heaven.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: All praise be to God who bestowed on me Ishmael and Isaac in old age. Verily my Lord listens to prayer.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “All praise is to Allah Who gave me Ismail and Ishaq, in my old age; indeed my Lord is the Listener of Prayer.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Praise be to God, who has given me, though I am old, Ishmael and Isaac; surely my Lord hears the petition.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: All praise be unto Allah who hath bestowed upon me, despite old age lsma'il and ls-haq; verily my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "All the praises and thanks be to Allah, Who has given me in old age Isma'il (Ishmael) and Ishaque (Isaac). Verily! My Lord is indeed the All-Hearer of invocations.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “Praise be to God, Who has given me, in my old age, Ishmael and Isaac. My Lord is the Hearer of Prayers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: All praise be to Allah Who, despite my old age, has given me Ishmael and Isaac. Surely my Lord hears all prayers.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "All praise is due to Allah, Who has given me in old age Isma'il and Ishaq. Verily, my Lord is indeed the All-Hearer of invocations."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Praise be to Allah Who hath given me, in my old age, Ishmael and Isaac! Lo! my Lord is indeed the Hearer of Prayer.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: All praise belongs to Allah, who gave me Ishmael and Isaac despite [my] old age. Indeed my Lord hears all supplications.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Praise be to Allah who has given me Ishmael and Isaac in my old age! Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of the supplication.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Praise to Allah, who has granted to me in old age Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: It is only God who deserves all praise. I praise Him for His giving me my sons Ishmael and Isaac during my old age. My Lord, certainly, hears all prayers.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Praise be to Allah, Who has given me in old age Ismail and Ishaq; most surely my Lord is the Hearer of prayer:

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Alhamdu lillahi allathee wahaba lee AAala alkibari ismaAAeela waishaqa inna rabbee lasameeAAu aldduAAai

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Praise be to God who has bestowed upon me, despite my old age, Ishmael and Isaac. Surely my Lord is the hearer of prayer.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Praise be to Allah, Who hath granted unto me in old age Isma'il and Isaac: for truly my Lord is He, the Hearer of Prayer!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Grant, O Lord, that I and my offspring may remain constant in devotion. Grant, O Lord, my supplication.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O my Lord! Maintain me as one who establishes prayer, and some of my descendants; O our Lord! and accept my prayer.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: My Lord, make me a performer of the prayer, and of my seed. Our Lord, and receive my petition.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: My Lord! make me establisher of prayer and also from my progeny, our Lord! and accept Thou my supplication.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O my Lord! Make me one who performs As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and (also) from my offspring, our Lord! And accept my invocation.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “My Lord, make me one who performs the prayer, and from my offspring. Our Lord, accept my supplication.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: My Lord! Enable me and my offspring to establish Prayer, and do accept, our Lord, this prayer of mine.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O my Lord! Make me one who performs Salah, and (also) from my offspring, our Lord! And accept my invocation."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: My Lord! Make me to establish proper worship, and some of my posterity (also); our Lord! and accept my prayer.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: My Lord! Make me a maintainer of prayer, and my descendants [as well]. Our Lord, accept my supplication.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: My Lord, make me and my descendants establishers of prayer. Our Lord, accept my prayer.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Lord, make me and my offspring steadfast in prayer and accept our worship.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: My Lord! make me keep up prayer and from my offspring (too), O our Lord, and accept my prayer:

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Rabbi ijAAalnee muqeema alssalati wamin thurriyyatee rabbana wtaqabbal duAAai

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Lord, grant that I may keep up the prayer, and so may my offspring. My Lord, accept my prayer.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O my Lord! make me one who establishes regular Prayer, and also (raise such) among my offspring O our Lord! and accept Thou my Prayer.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O Lord, forgive me, my parents and the faithful on the Day the reckoning is done."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O our Lord! And forgive me, and my parents, and all the Muslims on the day when the account will be established.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Our Lord, forgive Thou me and my parents, and the believers, upon the day when the reckoning shall come to pass.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Our Lord! forgive me and my parents and the believers on the Day whereon will be set up the reckoning.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents, and (all) the believers on the Day when the reckoning will be established."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “Our Lord, forgive me, and my parents, and the believers, on the Day the Reckoning takes place.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents and the believers on the Day when the reckoning will take place."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents, and (all) the believers on the Day when the reckoning will be established."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents and believers on the day when the account is cast.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents, and all the faithful, on the day when the reckoning is held.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Forgive me, our Lord, and forgive my parents and all the believers on the Day of Reckoning'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Lord, on the Day of Judgment, forgive me and my parents and all the believers."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O our Lord! grant me protection and my parents and the believers on the day when the reckoning shall come to pass!

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Rabbana ighfir lee waliwalidayya walilmumineena yawma yaqoomu alhisabu

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Forgive me, Lord, and forgive my parents and all the believers on the Day of Reckoning."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "O our Lord! cover (us) with Thy Forgiveness - me, my parents, and (all) Believers, on the Day that the Reckoning will be established!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Our angels came to Abraham with good news, and said: "Peace on you. "Peace on you too," said Abraham, and hastened to bring a roasted calf.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed Our angels came to Ibrahim with glad tidings – they said, “Peace”; he answered, “Peace” and without delay brought a roasted calf.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings; they said, 'Peace!' 'Peace,' he said; and presently he brought a roasted calf.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly Our messengers came unto Ibrahim with the glad tidings. The said: peace! He said: peace! And he tarried not till he brougt a calf roasted.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And verily, there came Our Messengers to Ibrahim (Abraham) with glad tidings. They said: Salam (greetings or peace!) He answered, Salam (greetings or peace!) and he hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Our messengers came to Abraham with good news. They said, “Peace.” He said, “Peace.” Soon after, he came with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed Our messengers came to Abraham, bearing glad tidings. They greeted him with 'peace', and Abraham answered back to them 'peace', and hurriedly brought to them a roasted calf.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And verily, there came Our messengers to Ibrahim with the glad tidings. They said: "Salaman (greetings or peace!)" He answered, "Salamun (greetings or peace!)," and he hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Our messengers cam unto Abraham with good news. They said: Peace! He answered: Peace! and delayed not to bring a roasted calf.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly Our messengers came to Abraham with the good news, and said, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ He replied. Presently he brought [for them] a roasted calf.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Our Messengers came to Abraham with glad tidings. They said: 'Peace' He replied 'Peace' and in a while brought them a roasted calf.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And certainly did Our messengers come to Abraham with good tidings; they said, "Peace." He said, "Peace," and did not delay in bringing [them] a roasted calf.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Our Messengers came to Abraham with glad news. They said, "Peace be with you." He replied similarly. After a short time he presented them with a roasted calf

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly Our apostles came to Ibrahim with good news. They said: Peace. Peace, said he, and he made no delay in bringing a roasted calf.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Our messengers came to Abraham with good news and greeted him with, "Peace." He too said, "Peace be on you," and hastened to bring a roasted calf.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: There came Our messengers to Abraham with glad tidings. They said, "Peace!" He answered, "Peace!" and hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When they did not stretch their hands towards it he became suspicious and afraid of them. They said: "Do not be afraid. We have been sent to the people of Lot."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And when he saw their hands not reaching towards it, he thought they were pretending and inwardly started fearing them; they said, “Do not be afraid – we are sent to the people of Lut.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when he saw their hands not reaching towards it, he was suspicious of them and conceived a fear of them. They said, 'Fear not; we have been sent to the people of Lot.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And when he beheld that their hands reached it not he misliked them, and ccnceived a fear of them. They said fear not verily we are sent unto the people of Lut.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: But when he saw their hands went not towards it (the meal), he felt some mistrust of them, and conceived a fear of them. They said: "Fear not, we have been sent against the people of Lout (Lot)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But when he saw their hands not reaching towards it, he became suspicious of them, and conceived a fear of them. They said, “Do not fear, we were sent to the people of Lot.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When he perceived that their hands could not reach it, he mistrusted them, and felt afraid of them. They said: 'Do not be afraid. We have been sent to the people of Lot.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: But when he saw their hands went not towards it (the meal), he mistrusted them, and conceived a fear of them. They said: "Fear not, we have been sent against the people of Lut."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when he saw their hands reached not to it, he mistrusted them and conceived a fear of them. They said: Fear not! Lo! we are sent unto the folk of Lot.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: But when he saw their hands not reaching for it, he took them amiss and felt a fear of them. They said, ‘Do not be afraid. We have been sent to the people of Lot.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But when he saw that their hands did not reach towards it, he was wary and became fearful of them, but they said: 'Do not be afraid. We are sent to thenation of Lot'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But when he saw their hands not reaching for it, he distrusted them and felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not. We have been sent to the people of Lot."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: but when he saw that their hands did not reach out for it, he could not know who they were and became afraid of them. They said, "Do not be afraid; we are God's angelic Messengers sent to the people of Lot."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But when he saw that their hands were not extended towards it, he deemed them strange and conceived fear of them. They said: Fear not, surely we are sent to Lut's people.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Falamma raa aydiyahum la tasilu ilayhi nakirahum waawjasa minhum kheefatan qaloo la takhaf inna orsilna ila qawmi lootin

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But when he saw that they made no move to eat, he found this strange and became afraid of them. They said, "Do not be afraid, for we have been sent to the people of Lot."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But when he saw their hands went not towards the (meal), he felt some mistrust of them, and conceived a fear of them. They said: "Fear not: We have been sent against the people of Lut."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: His wife who stood near, laughed as We gave her the good news of Isaac, and after Isaac of Jacob.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And his wife was standing by and she started laughing*, so We gave her glad tidings regarding Ishaq, and following Ishaq, regarding Yaqub.** (* She was glad that the disbelieving people of Lut would be destroyed.** The birth of these two.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And his wife was standing by; she laughed, therefore We gave her the glad tidings of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And his wife was standing. she laughed. Then We gave her the glad tidings of Is'haq, and after Is'haq, Ya'qub.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed (either, because the Messengers did not eat their food or for being glad for the destruction of the people of Lout (Lot). But We gave her glad tidings of Ishaque (Isaac), and after him, of Ya'qub (Jacob).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: His wife was standing by, so she laughed. And We gave her good news of Isaac; and after Isaac, Jacob.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Abraham's wife was standing by and on hearing this she laughed. And We gave her the good news of (the birth of) Isaac, and after Isaac, of Jacob.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed. But We gave her glad tidings of Ishaq, and after Ishaq, of Ya`qub.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And his wife, standing by laughed when We gave her good tidings (of the birth) of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: His wife, standing by, laughed as We gave her the good news of [the birth of] Isaac, and of Jacob, after Isaac.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: His wife (Sarah), who was standing nearby, laughed. Thereupon, We gave her the good news of Isaac, and after Isaac of Jacob.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And his Wife was standing, and she smiled. Then We gave her good tidings of Isaac and after Isaac, Jacob.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: His wife who was standing nearby, smiled and so We gave her the glad news that she would give birth to Isaac who would have a son, Jacob.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And his wife was standing (by), so she laughed, then We gave her the good news of Ishaq and after Ishaq of (a son's son) Yaqoub.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Waimraatuhu qaimatun fadahikat fabashsharnaha biishaqa wamin warai ishaqa yaAAqooba

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: His wife, who was standing nearby, laughed when We gave her the good news of Isaac, and after Isaac, Jacob.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: She said: "Woe betide me! Will I give birth when I am old and this my husband be aged? This is indeed surprising!"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: She said, “Oh woe to me – will I bear a child whereas I am an old woman, and this my husband, is an old man? This is something really extraordinary.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: She said, 'Woe is me! Shall I bear, being an old woman, and this my husband is an old man? This assuredly is a strange thing.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: She said: Oh for me shall bring forth when I am old, and this my husband is advanced in years! Verily a marvellous thing is this!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: She said (in astonishment): "Woe unto me! Shall I bear a child while I am an old woman, and here is my husband, an old man? Verily! This is a strange thing!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: She said, “Alas for me. Shall I give birth, when I am an old woman, and this, my husband, is an old man? This is truly a strange thing.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: She said: 'Woe is me! Shall I bear a child now that I am an old woman and my husband is well advanced in years. This is indeed strange!'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: She said (in astonishment): "Woe unto me! Shall I bear a child while I am an old woman, and here is my husband an old man Verily, this is a strange thing!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: She said: Oh woe is me! Shall I bear a child when I am an old woman, and this my husband is an old man? Lo! this is a strange thing!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: She said, ‘Oh, my! Shall I, an old woman, bear [children], and [while] this husband of mine is an old man?! That is indeed an odd thing!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: She replied: 'Alas for me! Shall I bear (a child) when I am old woman and my husband is advanced in years? This is indeed a strange thing'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: She said, "Woe to me! Shall I give birth while I am an old woman and this, my husband, is an old man? Indeed, this is an amazing thing!"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: She said, "Woe is me! How can I have a baby when I am barren and my husband is very old? This is certainly strange".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: She said: O wonder! shall I bear a son when I am an extremely old woman and this my husband an extremely old man? Most surely this is a wonderful thing.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qalat ya waylata aalidu waana AAajoozun wahatha baAAlee shaykhan inna hatha lashayon AAajeebun

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: She said, "Alas! Shall I bear a child in this old age, while my husband here is also old? This is indeed a strange thing!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: She said: "Alas for me! shall I bear a child, seeing I am an old woman, and my husband here is an old man? That would indeed be a wonderful thing!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Why are you surprised at the command of God? God's mercy and blessings be upon you, O members of this household," they said. "Verily He is worthy of praise and glory."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'What, dost thou marvel at God's command? The mercy of God and His blessings be upon you, O people of the House! Surely He is All-laudable, All-glorious.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said marvellest thou at the decree of Allah? Mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, people of the house, verily He is Praiseworthy, Glorious.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Do you wonder at the Decree of Allah? The Mercy of Allah and His Blessings be on you, O the family [of Ibrahim (Abraham)]. Surely, He (Allah) is All-Praiseworthy, All-Glorious."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Do you marvel at the decree of God? The mercy and blessings of God are upon you, O people of the house. He is Praiseworthy and Glorious.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: 'Do you wonder at Allah's decree? Allah's mercy and His blessings be upon you, O people of the house. Surely, He is Praiseworthy, Glorious.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Do you wonder at the decree of Allah The mercy of Allah and His blessings be on you, O the family [of Ibrahim]. Surely, He (Allah) is All-Praiseworthy, All-Glorious."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Wonderest thou at the commandment of Allah? The mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, O people of the house! Lo! He is Owner of Praise, Owner of Glory!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Are you amazed at Allah’s dispensation? [That is] Allah’s mercy and His blessings upon you, members of the household. Indeed He is all-laudable, all-glorious.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'What, do you marvel at the command of Allah? The Mercy of Allah and His Blessings be upon you, O people of the House. Indeed, He isPraised, Exalted'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Are you amazed at the decree of Allah? May the mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, people of the house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy and Honorable."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They replied, "Would you be surprised at God's decree? People of the house, may God's mercy and blessings be with you. God is Appreciative and Glorious."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Do you wonder at Allah's bidding? The mercy of Allah and His blessings are on you, O people of the house, surely He is Praised, Glorious.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Are you astonished at God's command? May the mercy of God and His blessings be upon you, O people of this house. Surely, He is praiseworthy and glorious."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "Dost thou wonder at Allah's decree? The grace of Allah and His blessings on you, o ye people of the house! for He is indeed worthy of all praise, full of all glory!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When Abraham's fear was dispelled, and the good news had come to him, he pleaded for the people of Lot with Us.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So, when the awe departed from Abraham and the good tidings came to him, he was disputing with Us concerning the people of Lot;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when the alarm had departed from Ibrahim and the glad tidings had come home unto him, he took to disputing with us for the people of Lut

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then when the fear had gone away from (the mind of) Ibrahim (Abraham), and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with Us (Our Messengers) for the people of Lout (Lot).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When Abraham's fear subsided, and the good news had reached him, he started pleading with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thus when fear had left Abraham and the good news had been conveyed to him, he began to dispute with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then when the fear had gone away from (the mind of) Ibrahim, and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with Us (Our messengers) for the people of Lut.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when the awe departed from Abraham, and the glad news reached him, he pleaded with Us on behalf of the folk of Lot.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So when the awe had left Abraham and the good news had reached him, he pleaded with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when the wonderment departed from Abraham and the glad tidings reached him, he pleaded with Us for the nation of Lot;

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when the fright had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Abraham had controlled his fear and received the glad news, he started to plead with Us for the people of Lot;

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when fear had gone away from Ibrahim and good news came to him, he began to plead with Us for Lut's people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When the fear had left Abraham, and the glad tidings had been conveyed to him, he began to plead with Us for Lot's people,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut's people.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Abraham was kind, compassionate, and penitent.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed Ibrahim is most forbearing, very soft hearted, penitent.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Abraham was clement, compassionate, penitent.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily Ibrahim was forbearing, long-suffering, penitent.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, Ibrahim (Abraham) was, without doubt, forbearing, used to invoke Allah with humility, and was repentant (to Allah all the time, again and again).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Abraham was gentle, kind, penitent.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely Abraham was forbearing, tenderhearted and oft-turning to Allah.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Verily, Ibrahim was, without doubt, forbearing, used to invoke Allah with humility, and was repentant.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! Abraham was mild, imploring, penitent.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Abraham was indeed most forbearing, plaintive, [and] penitent.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: indeed, Abraham was forbearing, tenderhearted and penitent.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and [frequently] returning [to Allah].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham was certainly a forbearing, compassionate, and tender-hearted person.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Most surely Ibrahim was forbearing, tender-hearted, oft-returning (to Allah):

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: for Abraham was forbearing, tender-hearted and oft-returning to God.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: For Abraham was, without doubt, forbearing (of faults), compassionate, and given to look to Allah.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Desist from pleading, O Abraham," (they said). "Your Lord's command has verily been issued, and a punishment that cannot be averted is bound to fall on them."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O Ibrahim, turn away from this; indeed your Lord’s command has come; and indeed a punishment will come upon them, which will not be averted.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'O Abraham, turn away from this; thy Lord's command has surely come, and there is coming upon them a chastisement not to be turned back.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Ibrahim! leave off this; verily the decree from thy Lord hath already come, and verily they! upon them is coming a torment unavoidable.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O Ibrahim (Abraham)! Forsake this. Indeed, the Commandment of your Lord has gone forth. Verily, there will come a torment for them which cannot be turned back."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “O Abraham, refrain from this. The command of your Lord has come; they have incurred an irreversible punishment.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon (Our angels) said to him: 'O Abraham! Desist from this, for indeed your Lord's command has come; and a chastisement which cannot be averted is about to befall them.' words literally suggest; the purpose is merely to express a sense of wonder.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O Ibrahim! Forsake this. Indeed, the commandment of your Lord has gone forth. Verily, there will come a torment for them which cannot be turned back."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (It was said) O Abraham! Forsake this! Lo! thy Lord's commandment hath gone forth, and lo! there cometh unto them a doom which cannot be repelled.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘O Abraham, let this matter alone! Your Lord’s edict has certainly come, and an irrevocable punishment shall overtake them.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (It was said:) 'Abraham, turn away from this; your Lord's command has indeed come, and there is coming upon them a punishment that will not be turned back'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [The angels said], "O Abraham, give up this [plea]. Indeed, the command of your Lord has come, and indeed, there will reach them a punishment that cannot be repelled."

translation.author: Sarwar
