translation.text: We said, "Abraham, avoid asking Us such questions. Your Lord's decree has already been issued and an inevitable torment will strike these people."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O Ibrahim! leave off this, surely the decree of your Lord has come to pass, and surely there must come to them a chastisement that cannot be averted.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We said, "Abraham, cease your pleading: the command of your Lord has gone forth. There shall fall upon them a punishment which none can avert!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O Abraham! Seek not this. The decree of thy Lord hath gone forth: for them there cometh a penalty that cannot be turned back!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Inform them about the matter of Abraham's guests.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And tell them of the guests of Abraham,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And declare thou unto them of Ibrahim's guests.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And tell them about the guests (the angels) of Ibrahim (Abraham).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And inform them of the guests of Abraham.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And tell them about Abraham's guests.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And tell them about the guests (i.e., the angels) of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And tell them of Abraham's guests,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Tell them of Abraham's guests.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Tell them about the guests of Abraham

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And inform them of the guests of Ibrahim:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Tell them about Abraham's guests:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Tell them about the guests of Abraham.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When they came to him and said: "Peace," he answered: "Truly we are afraid of you."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: when they entered unto him, saying, 'Peace!' He said, 'Behold, we are afraid of you.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: When they entered unto him, and said; peace! He said: verily we are afraid of you.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When they entered unto him, and said: Salaman (peace)! [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Indeed! We are afraid of you."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When they entered upon him, and said, “Peace.” He said, “We are wary of you.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When they came to Abraham they said: "Peace be upon you!" He replied: "Indeed we feel afraid of you."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When they entered upon him, and said: "Salaman (peace!)." He said: "Indeed we are frightened of you."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (How) when they came in unto him, and said: Peace. He said: Lo! we are afraid of you.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: when they entered into his presence and said, ‘Peace!’ He said, ‘We are indeed afraid of you.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They entered to him and said: 'Peace' but he replied: 'We are afraid of you'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: who came to him saying, "Peace be with you." Abraham said, "We are afraid of you".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When they entered upon him, they said, Peace. He said: Surely we are afraid of you.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: when they came to him they greeted him with: "Peace." He said,"We feel afraid of you."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When they entered his presence and said, "Peace!" He said, "We feel afraid of you!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Have no fear," they said. "We bring you news of a son full of wisdom."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Do not fear – we convey to you the glad tidings of a knowledgeable boy.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Be not afraid; behold, we give thee good tidings of a cunning boy.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: be not afraid; verily we bear thou the glad tidings of a boy knowing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They (the angels) said: "Do not be afraid! We give you glad tidings of a boy (son) possessing much knowledge and wisdom."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Do not fear; we bring you good news of a boy endowed with knowledge.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: "Do not feel afraid, for we give you the good news of a wise boy."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Do not be afraid! We bring you the good news of a boy possessing much knowledge and wisdom."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Be not afraid! Lo! we bring thee good tidings of a boy possessing wisdom.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Do not be afraid. Indeed we give you the good news of a wise son.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Do not be afraid' they answered. 'We come to give you glad tidings of a knowledgeable child'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They replied, "Do not be afraid. We have brought you the glad news of (the birth) of a learned son".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Be not afraid, surely we give you the good news of a boy, possessing knowledge.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo la tawjal inna nubashshiruka bighulamin AAaleemin

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Do not be afraid. We come to you with good news. You shall have a son who shall be endowed with great knowledge."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "Fear not! We give thee glad tidings of a son endowed with wisdom."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "You bring me the good news now," he said, "when old age has come upon me. What good news are you giving me then?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He said, “Do you convey to me the glad tidings upon old age reaching me? So upon what do you convey glad tidings?” (* Prophet Ibrahim said this out of surprise.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'What, do you give me good tidings, though old age has smitten me? Of what do you

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: bear ye me glad tidings when old age hath touched me? of what then ye bear me glad tidings?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Do you give me glad tidings (of a son) when old age has overtaken me? Of what then is your news?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Do you bring me good news, when old age has overtaken me? What good news do you bring?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: "What, do you give me this tiding though old age has smitten me? Just consider what tiding do you give me!"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Do you give me this good news while old age has overtaken me Of what then is your news about"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Bring ye me good tidings (of a son) when old age hath overtaken me? Of what then can ye bring good tidings?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Do you give me good news though old age has befallen me? What is the good news that you bring me?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'What is this, do you bring me glad tidings even though I am old' Of what do you give me glad tidings'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham asked, "Are you giving me the glad news of a son in my old age? What reason can you give for such glad news?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Do you give me good news (of a son) when old age has come upon me?-- Of what then do you give me good news!

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He said, "Do you bring me such news despite my old age? What kind of good news are you bringing me?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Do ye give me glad tidings that old age has seized me? Of what, then, is your good news?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "We have given you the happy tidings of a truth," they replied. "So do not be one of those who despair."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “We have given you true tidings, therefore do not lose hope.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: give me good tidings?' They said, 'We give thee good tidings of truth. Be not of those that despair.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: we bear tidings of a truth; be then thou not of the desponding.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They (the angels) said: "We give you glad tidings in truth. So be not of the despairing ones."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “We bring you good news in truth, so do not despair.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: "The good tiding we give you is of truth. Do not, therefore, be of those who despair."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "We give you good news in truth. So do not be of those who despair."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: We bring thee good tidings in truth. So be not thou of the despairing.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘We bring you good news in truth; so do not be despondent.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They replied: 'In truth we have given you glad tidings, do not be one of those who despair'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "We have given you the glad news for a true reason so do not despair".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: We give you good news with truth, therefore be not of the despairing.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo bashsharnaka bialhaqqi fala takun mina alqaniteena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "We have, indeed, given you glad tidings in truth; do not therefore despair."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "We give thee glad tidings in truth: be not then in despair!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Who would despair of the mercy of his Lord," he answered, "but those who go astray."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, excepting those that are astray?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: and who despondeth of the mercy of his Lord except the astray

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "And who despairs of the Mercy of his Lord except those who are astray?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “And who despairs of his Lord’s mercy but the lost?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: "Who despairs of the Mercy of his Lord except the misguided?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except those who are astray"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: And who despaireth of the mercy of his Lord save those who are astray?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Who despairs of his Lord’s mercy except the astray?!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He replied: 'And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, except those that are astray?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "No one despairs of the mercy of his Lord except those who are in error.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord but the erring ones?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He said, "Who but the misguided despair of the mercy of their Lord?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, but such as go astray?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And asked them: "What matter, O angels, brings you here?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'And what is your business, envoys?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: what is your errand, sent ones?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham) again] said: "What then is the business on which you have come, O Messengers?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “So what is your business, O envoys?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He added: "What is your errand O sent ones?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "What then is the business for which you have come, O messengers"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: And afterward what is your business, O ye messengers (of Allah)?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He asked: 'Messengers, what is your errand'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Messengers, what is your task?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: What is your business then, O apostles?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then he asked, "What then is your business, O messengers?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come), O ye messengers (of Allah)?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "We have been sent," they said, "to (punish) a sinful people,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “We have been sent towards a guilty nation.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'We have been sent unto a people of sinners,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: verily we have been sent unto a people guilty-

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They (the angels) said: "We have been sent to a people who are Mujrimun (criminals, disbelievers, polytheists, sinners).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “We were sent to a sinful people.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: "Verily we have been sent to a guilty people

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "We have been sent to a guilty people."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: We have been sent unto a guilty folk,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘We have been sent toward a guilty people,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They replied: 'We are sent to sinful nation.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "We are sent to a sinful people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Surely we are sent towards a guilty people,

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo inna orsilna ila qawmin mujrimeena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "We have been sent forth to a guilty people."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Except the family of Lot whom we shall save

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Except the family of Lut; we shall rescue all of them.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: excepting the folk of Lot; them we shall deliver

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: All except the household of Lut; surely we are going to deliver all of them.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "(All) except the family of Lout (Lot). Them all we are surely going to save (from destruction).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “Except for the family of Lot; we will save them all.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: excepting the household of Lot. We shall deliver all of them,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "(All) except the family of Lut, all of whom we are to save (from the destruction)."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (All) save the family of Lot. Them we shall deliver every one,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: [who shall perish] except the family of Lot. We will indeed deliver all of them,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Except Lot's family, of whom we shall save all,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Only the family of Lot will all be saved,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Except Lut's followers: We will most surely deliver them all,

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Illa ala lootin inna lamunajjoohum ajmaAAeena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Except for Lot's household, all of whom we shall rescue,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Excepting the adherents of Lut: them we are certainly (charged) to save (from harm),- All -

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Other than his wife who, it is decreed, will remain with those who will stay behind."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Except his wife – we have decided that she is of those who will stay behind.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: all together, excepting his wife -- we have decreed, she shall surely be of those that tarry.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: But not his wife; we have decreed that she will be of those staying behind.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Except his wife, of whom We have decreed that she shall be of those who remain behind (i.e. she will be destroyed)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “Except for his wife.” We have determined that she will be of those who lag behind.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: except his wife (about whom Allah says that) We have decreed that she shall be among those who stay behind."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Except for his wife, of whom We have decreed that she shall be of those who remain behind."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Except his wife, of whom We had decreed that she should be of those who stay behind.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: except his wife, [who], We have ordained, will indeed be among those who remain behind.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: but his wife. We decreed that she should be amongst those who remain behind.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Except his wife." Allah decreed that she is of those who remain behind.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: except his wife who is doomed to be left behind."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Except his wife; We ordained that she shall surely be of those who remain behind.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Illa imraatahu qaddarna innaha lamina alghabireena

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: except his wife. We have decreed that she will be among those who remain behind [and will be lost].

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Except his wife, who, We have ascertained, will be among those who will lag behind."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Has the story of Abraham's honoured guests come to you?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Hast thou received the story of the honoured guests of Abraham?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Hath there come Unto thee the story of Ibrahim's honoured guests?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Has the story reached you, of the honoured guests [three angels; Jibrael (Gabriel) along with another two] of Ibrahim (Abraham)?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Has the story of Abraham’s honorable guests reached you?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Prophet), did the story of Abraham's honoured guests reach you?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Has the story reached you, of the honored guests of Ibrahim

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Hath the story of Abraham's honoured guests reached thee (O Muhammad)?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Did you receive the story of Abraham’s honoured guests?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Have you heard the story of Abraham's honored guests?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Have you heard the story of the honorable guests of Abraham?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Has there come to you information about the honored guests of Ibrahim?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Have you heard the story of Abraham's honoured guests?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Has the story reached thee, of the honoured guests of Abraham?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When they came to him, they said: "Peace." He answered: "Peace." They were a people he did not recognise.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: When they came to him and said, “Peace”; he answered, “Peace”; and thought, “These people are not familiar.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When they entered unto him, saying 'Peace!' he said 'Peace! You are a people unknown to me.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: When they came in Unto him, and said:'peace!' he said: 'peace'! - people unknown.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When they came in to him, and said, "Salam, (peace be upon you)!" He answered; "Salam, (peace be upon you)," and said: "You are a people unknown to me,"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When they entered upon him, they said, “Peace.” He said, “Peace, strangers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When they came to him, they said: “Peace”; he said: “Peace also be to you; (you seem to be) a group of strangers.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When they came in to him and said: "Salaman!" He answered: "Salamun" and said: "You are a people unknown to me."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When they came in unto him and said: Peace! he answered, Peace! (and thought): Folk unknown (to me).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When they entered into his presence, they said, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ He answered, ‘[You are] an unfamiliar folk.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They entered to him and said: 'Peace' And he replied: 'Peace, you are people unknown to me'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace, [you are] a people unknown.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When they came to him saying, "Peace be with you," he replied to their greeting in the same manner and said to himself, "These are a strange people".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: When they entered upon him, they said: Peace. Peace, said he, a strange people.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Ith dakhaloo AAalayhi faqaloo salaman qala salamun qawmun munkaroona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When they came to him they said, "Peace!" He answered, "Peace!" [saying to himself]. "They are strangers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold, they entered his presence, and said: "Peace!" He said, "Peace!" (and thought, "These seem) unusual people."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So he hurried to the house and brought a fatted calf,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then he turned to his household and brought a fattened calf,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he turned away privately Unto his household, and brought a calf fatted.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then he turned to his household, so brought out a roasted calf [as the property of Ibrahim (Abraham) was mainly cows].

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then he slipped away to his family, and brought a fatted calf.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then he went back to his family and brought a fat roasted calf

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then he turned to his household, and brought out a roasted calf.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then he went apart unto his housefolk so that they brought a fatted calf;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then he retired to his family and brought a fat [roasted] calf,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So he turned to his household and brought a fattened calf.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He went quietly to his wife and returned to his guests with a fat, roasted calf.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then he turned aside to his family secretly and brought a fat (roasted) calf,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then he turned quickly to his household, and brought a fatted calf,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then he turned quickly to his household, brought out a fatted calf,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And placing it before them said: "Won't you eat?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He then presented it before them and said, “Do you not eat?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and he laid it before them saying, 'Will you not eat?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And he set it before them, and said: wherefore eat ye not?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And placed it before them, (saying): "Will you not eat?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He set it before them. He said, “Will you not eat?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and laid it before them, saying: “Will you not eat?”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And placed it before them (saying): "Will you not eat"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And he set it before them, saying: Will ye not eat?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and put it near them. He said, ‘Will you not eat?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He set it before them, saying: 'Will you not eat'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He placed it before them. Then he said, "Why are you not eating?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So he brought it near them. He said: What! will you not eat?

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Faqarrabahu ilayhim qala ala takuloona

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and placed it before them. "Will you not eat?" he said,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And placed it before them.. he said, "Will ye not eat?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He felt afraid of them; but they said: "Have no fear," and gave him the good news of a wise son.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He therefore inwardly sensed fear of them; they said, “Do not fear!”; and they gave him the glad tidings of a knowledgeable son.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then he conceived a fear of them. They said, 'Be not afraid!' And they gave him good tidings of a cunning boy.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he conceived a fear of them. They said: fear not. And they gave him the tidings of a youth knowing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then he conceived a fear of them (when they ate not). They said: "Fear not." And they gave him glad tidings of an intelligent son, having knowledge (about Allah and His religion of True Monotheism).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And he harbored fear of them. They said, “Do not fear,” and they announced to him the good news of a knowledgeable boy.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then he became afraid of them. They said: “Fear not,” and announced to him the good news of (the birth of) a boy endowed with knowledge.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then he conceived fear of them (when they ate not). They said: "Fear not." And they gave him glad tidings of a son having knowledge.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then he conceived a fear of them. They said: Fear not! and gave him tidings of (the birth of) a wise son.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then he felt a fear of them. They said, ‘Do not be afraid!’ and they gave him the good news of a wise son.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then he conceived a fear about them, and they said: 'Have no fear', and gave him the glad tidings that he was to have a knowledgeable son.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And he felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He began to feel afraid. They said, "Do not be afraid," and then gave him the glad news of the birth of a knowledgeable son.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So he conceived in his mind a fear on account of them. They said: Fear not. And they gave him the good news of a boy possessing knowledge.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Faawjasa minhum kheefatan qaloo la takhaf wabashsharoohu bighulamin AAaleemin

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: beginning to be afraid of them. But they said, "Don't be afraid"; and they gave him the good news of a son who would be endowed with knowledge.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (When they did not eat), He conceived a fear of them. They said, "Fear not," and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with knowledge.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: His wife came out lamenting, striking her forehead, and said: "I, am old and barren woman?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So his wife came screaming, and striking her forehead cried, “What! For a barren old woman?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then came forward his wife, clamouring, and she smote her face, and said, 'An old woman, barren!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then his wife drew near vociferating, and smote her face, and said: an old barren woman!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then his wife came forward with a loud voice, she smote her face, and said: "A barren old woman!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: His wife came forward crying. She clasped her face, and said, “A barren old woman?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: So hearing his wife went forth shouting. She struck her face and exclaimed: “A barren old woman am I.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then his wife came forward with a loud voice; she smote her face, and said: "A barren old woman!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then his wife came forward, making moan, and smote her face, and cried: A barren old woman!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then his wife came forward crying [with joy]. She beat her face, and said, ‘A barren old woman!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Sarah) his wife came with an exclamation and clasped her face, and said: 'Surely, I am a barren old woman'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: His wife came forward, crying and beating her face, saying, "I am an old barren woman!"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then his wife came up in great grief, and she struck her face and said: An old barren woman!

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Faaqbalati imraatuhu fee sarratin fasakkat wajhaha waqalat AAajoozun AAaqeemun

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then his wife came forward, crying and beating her brow. She said, "I am surely a barren, old woman."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: she smote her forehead and said: "A barren old woman!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "Thus said your Lord. He is indeed all-wise and all-knowing."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “This is how your Lord has decreed; indeed He only is the Wise, the All Knowing.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'So says thy Lord; He is the All-wise, the All-knowing.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: even so saith thine Lords Verily He! He is the Wise, the Knower.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Even so says your Lord. Verily, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knower."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Thus spoke your Lord. He is the Wise, the Knowing.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: “So has your Lord said (that you shall have a boy). Surely He is Most Wise, All-Knowing.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Even so says your Lord. Verily, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knower."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Even so saith thy Lord. Lo! He is the Wise, the Knower.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘So has your Lord said. Indeed He is the All-wise, the All-knowing.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Such, says your Lord' they replied: 'He is the Wise, the Knower'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "This is true but your Lord has said, (that you will have a son); He is All-wise and All-knowing".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Thus says your Lord: Surely He is the Wise, the Knowing.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qaloo kathaliki qala rabbuki innahu huwa alhakeemu alAAaleemu

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "Such is the will of your Lord," they replied. "He is the Wise, the All Knowing."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Even so has thy Lord spoken: and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "What is then your business, O messengers?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Said Ibrahim, “What is your task, O the sent angels?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he, 'And what is your business, envoys?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: what then is your errand! O ye sent ones!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O Messengers?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “What is your business, O envoys?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: “Envoys (of Allah), what is your errand?”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Ibrahim) said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O messengers"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Abraham) said: And (afterward) what is your errand, O ye sent (from Allah)?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Messengers' said he (Abraham), 'what is your errand'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham asked, "Messengers, what is your task?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: What is your affair then, O apostles!

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham asked, "What is your errand, O messengers?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Abraham) said: "And what, O ye Messengers, is your errand (now)?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: His wife who stood near, laughed as We gave her the good news of Isaac, and after Isaac of Jacob.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And his wife was standing by and she started laughing*, so We gave her glad tidings regarding Ishaq, and following Ishaq, regarding Yaqub.** (* She was glad that the disbelieving people of Lut would be destroyed.** The birth of these two.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And his wife was standing by; she laughed, therefore We gave her the glad tidings of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And his wife was standing. she laughed. Then We gave her the glad tidings of Is'haq, and after Is'haq, Ya'qub.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed (either, because the Messengers did not eat their food or for being glad for the destruction of the people of Lout (Lot). But We gave her glad tidings of Ishaque (Isaac), and after him, of Ya'qub (Jacob).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: His wife was standing by, so she laughed. And We gave her good news of Isaac; and after Isaac, Jacob.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Abraham's wife was standing by and on hearing this she laughed. And We gave her the good news of (the birth of) Isaac, and after Isaac, of Jacob.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed. But We gave her glad tidings of Ishaq, and after Ishaq, of Ya`qub.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And his wife, standing by laughed when We gave her good tidings (of the birth) of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: His wife, standing by, laughed as We gave her the good news of [the birth of] Isaac, and of Jacob, after Isaac.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: His wife (Sarah), who was standing nearby, laughed. Thereupon, We gave her the good news of Isaac, and after Isaac of Jacob.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And his Wife was standing, and she smiled. Then We gave her good tidings of Isaac and after Isaac, Jacob.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: His wife who was standing nearby, smiled and so We gave her the glad news that she would give birth to Isaac who would have a son, Jacob.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And his wife was standing (by), so she laughed, then We gave her the good news of Ishaq and after Ishaq of (a son's son) Yaqoub.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Waimraatuhu qaimatun fadahikat fabashsharnaha biishaqa wamin warai ishaqa yaAAqooba

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: His wife, who was standing nearby, laughed when We gave her the good news of Isaac, and after Isaac, Jacob.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And his wife was standing (there), and she laughed: But we gave her glad tidings of Isaac, and after him, of Jacob.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: She said: "Woe betide me! Will I give birth when I am old and this my husband be aged? This is indeed surprising!"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: She said, “Oh woe to me – will I bear a child whereas I am an old woman, and this my husband, is an old man? This is something really extraordinary.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: She said, 'Woe is me! Shall I bear, being an old woman, and this my husband is an old man? This assuredly is a strange thing.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: She said: Oh for me shall bring forth when I am old, and this my husband is advanced in years! Verily a marvellous thing is this!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: She said (in astonishment): "Woe unto me! Shall I bear a child while I am an old woman, and here is my husband, an old man? Verily! This is a strange thing!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: She said, “Alas for me. Shall I give birth, when I am an old woman, and this, my husband, is an old man? This is truly a strange thing.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: She said: 'Woe is me! Shall I bear a child now that I am an old woman and my husband is well advanced in years. This is indeed strange!'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: She said (in astonishment): "Woe unto me! Shall I bear a child while I am an old woman, and here is my husband an old man Verily, this is a strange thing!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: She said: Oh woe is me! Shall I bear a child when I am an old woman, and this my husband is an old man? Lo! this is a strange thing!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: She said, ‘Oh, my! Shall I, an old woman, bear [children], and [while] this husband of mine is an old man?! That is indeed an odd thing!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: She replied: 'Alas for me! Shall I bear (a child) when I am old woman and my husband is advanced in years? This is indeed a strange thing'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: She said, "Woe to me! Shall I give birth while I am an old woman and this, my husband, is an old man? Indeed, this is an amazing thing!"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: She said, "Woe is me! How can I have a baby when I am barren and my husband is very old? This is certainly strange".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: She said: O wonder! shall I bear a son when I am an extremely old woman and this my husband an extremely old man? Most surely this is a wonderful thing.

translation.author: Transliteration
translation.text: Qalat ya waylata aalidu waana AAajoozun wahatha baAAlee shaykhan inna hatha lashayon AAajeebun

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: She said, "Alas! Shall I bear a child in this old age, while my husband here is also old? This is indeed a strange thing!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: She said: "Alas for me! shall I bear a child, seeing I am an old woman, and my husband here is an old man? That would indeed be a wonderful thing!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Why are you surprised at the command of God? God's mercy and blessings be upon you, O members of this household," they said. "Verily He is worthy of praise and glory."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'What, dost thou marvel at God's command? The mercy of God and His blessings be upon you, O people of the House! Surely He is All-laudable, All-glorious.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said marvellest thou at the decree of Allah? Mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, people of the house, verily He is Praiseworthy, Glorious.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Do you wonder at the Decree of Allah? The Mercy of Allah and His Blessings be on you, O the family [of Ibrahim (Abraham)]. Surely, He (Allah) is All-Praiseworthy, All-Glorious."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Do you marvel at the decree of God? The mercy and blessings of God are upon you, O people of the house. He is Praiseworthy and Glorious.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: 'Do you wonder at Allah's decree? Allah's mercy and His blessings be upon you, O people of the house. Surely, He is Praiseworthy, Glorious.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Do you wonder at the decree of Allah The mercy of Allah and His blessings be on you, O the family [of Ibrahim]. Surely, He (Allah) is All-Praiseworthy, All-Glorious."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Wonderest thou at the commandment of Allah? The mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, O people of the house! Lo! He is Owner of Praise, Owner of Glory!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Are you amazed at Allah’s dispensation? [That is] Allah’s mercy and His blessings upon you, members of the household. Indeed He is all-laudable, all-glorious.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'What, do you marvel at the command of Allah? The Mercy of Allah and His Blessings be upon you, O people of the House. Indeed, He isPraised, Exalted'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Are you amazed at the decree of Allah? May the mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, people of the house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy and Honorable."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They replied, "Would you be surprised at God's decree? People of the house, may God's mercy and blessings be with you. God is Appreciative and Glorious."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Do you wonder at Allah's bidding? The mercy of Allah and His blessings are on you, O people of the house, surely He is Praised, Glorious.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Are you astonished at God's command? May the mercy of God and His blessings be upon you, O people of this house. Surely, He is praiseworthy and glorious."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "Dost thou wonder at Allah's decree? The grace of Allah and His blessings on you, o ye people of the house! for He is indeed worthy of all praise, full of all glory!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So We gave him the good news of Isaac, apostle, who is among the righteous.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We gave him the good tidings of Isaac, a Prophet, one of the righteous.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We gave him the glad tidings of Is-haq, a prophet, and of the righteous.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We gave him the glad tidings of Ishaque (Isaac) a Prophet from the righteous.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We gave him good news of Isaac, a prophet, one of the righteous.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We gave him the good news of Isaac, a Prophet and among the righteous ones.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We gave him the glad tidings of Ishaq -- a Prophet from the righteous.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And we gave him tidings of the birth of Isaac, a prophet of the righteous.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And We gave him the good news of [the birth of] Isaac, a prophet, one of the righteous.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then, We gave him the glad tidings of Isaac, a Prophet, one of the righteous,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave him the glad news of the birth of Isaac, one of the righteous Prophets.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We gave him the good news of Ishaq, a prophet among the good ones.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Abraham the good news of Isaac, a prophet and a righteous man,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We gave him the good news of Isaac - a prophet,- one of the Righteous.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When Abraham's fear was dispelled, and the good news had come to him, he pleaded for the people of Lot with Us.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So, when the awe departed from Abraham and the good tidings came to him, he was disputing with Us concerning the people of Lot;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when the alarm had departed from Ibrahim and the glad tidings had come home unto him, he took to disputing with us for the people of Lut

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then when the fear had gone away from (the mind of) Ibrahim (Abraham), and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with Us (Our Messengers) for the people of Lout (Lot).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When Abraham's fear subsided, and the good news had reached him, he started pleading with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thus when fear had left Abraham and the good news had been conveyed to him, he began to dispute with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then when the fear had gone away from (the mind of) Ibrahim, and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with Us (Our messengers) for the people of Lut.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when the awe departed from Abraham, and the glad news reached him, he pleaded with Us on behalf of the folk of Lot.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So when the awe had left Abraham and the good news had reached him, he pleaded with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when the wonderment departed from Abraham and the glad tidings reached him, he pleaded with Us for the nation of Lot;

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when the fright had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Abraham had controlled his fear and received the glad news, he started to plead with Us for the people of Lot;

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when fear had gone away from Ibrahim and good news came to him, he began to plead with Us for Lut's people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When the fear had left Abraham, and the glad tidings had been conveyed to him, he began to plead with Us for Lot's people,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut's people.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Abraham was kind, compassionate, and penitent.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed Ibrahim is most forbearing, very soft hearted, penitent.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Abraham was clement, compassionate, penitent.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily Ibrahim was forbearing, long-suffering, penitent.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, Ibrahim (Abraham) was, without doubt, forbearing, used to invoke Allah with humility, and was repentant (to Allah all the time, again and again).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Abraham was gentle, kind, penitent.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely Abraham was forbearing, tenderhearted and oft-turning to Allah.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Verily, Ibrahim was, without doubt, forbearing, used to invoke Allah with humility, and was repentant.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! Abraham was mild, imploring, penitent.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Abraham was indeed most forbearing, plaintive, [and] penitent.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: indeed, Abraham was forbearing, tenderhearted and penitent.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and [frequently] returning [to Allah].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham was certainly a forbearing, compassionate, and tender-hearted person.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Most surely Ibrahim was forbearing, tender-hearted, oft-returning (to Allah):

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: for Abraham was forbearing, tender-hearted and oft-returning to God.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: For Abraham was, without doubt, forbearing (of faults), compassionate, and given to look to Allah.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Desist from pleading, O Abraham," (they said). "Your Lord's command has verily been issued, and a punishment that cannot be averted is bound to fall on them."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O Ibrahim, turn away from this; indeed your Lord’s command has come; and indeed a punishment will come upon them, which will not be averted.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'O Abraham, turn away from this; thy Lord's command has surely come, and there is coming upon them a chastisement not to be turned back.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Ibrahim! leave off this; verily the decree from thy Lord hath already come, and verily they! upon them is coming a torment unavoidable.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O Ibrahim (Abraham)! Forsake this. Indeed, the Commandment of your Lord has gone forth. Verily, there will come a torment for them which cannot be turned back."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “O Abraham, refrain from this. The command of your Lord has come; they have incurred an irreversible punishment.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon (Our angels) said to him: 'O Abraham! Desist from this, for indeed your Lord's command has come; and a chastisement which cannot be averted is about to befall them.' words literally suggest; the purpose is merely to express a sense of wonder.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O Ibrahim! Forsake this. Indeed, the commandment of your Lord has gone forth. Verily, there will come a torment for them which cannot be turned back."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (It was said) O Abraham! Forsake this! Lo! thy Lord's commandment hath gone forth, and lo! there cometh unto them a doom which cannot be repelled.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘O Abraham, let this matter alone! Your Lord’s edict has certainly come, and an irrevocable punishment shall overtake them.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (It was said:) 'Abraham, turn away from this; your Lord's command has indeed come, and there is coming upon them a punishment that will not be turned back'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [The angels said], "O Abraham, give up this [plea]. Indeed, the command of your Lord has come, and indeed, there will reach them a punishment that cannot be repelled."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We said, "Abraham, avoid asking Us such questions. Your Lord's decree has already been issued and an inevitable torment will strike these people."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O Ibrahim! leave off this, surely the decree of your Lord has come to pass, and surely there must come to them a chastisement that cannot be averted.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We said, "Abraham, cease your pleading: the command of your Lord has gone forth. There shall fall upon them a punishment which none can avert!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O Abraham! Seek not this. The decree of thy Lord hath gone forth: for them there cometh a penalty that cannot be turned back!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When Our messengers came to Abraham with good news, they said: "We have to destroy this city as its inhabitants have become sinful."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And when Our sent angels came with glad tidings to Ibrahim, they said, “We will surely destroy the people of that town; indeed its inhabitants are unjust.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, 'We shall destroy the people of this city, for its people are evildoers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And when Our messengers came unto Ibrahim with the glad tidings, they said: verily we are about to destroy the inhabitants of that city: verily the inhabitants thereof have been wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when Our Messengers came to Ibrahim (Abraham) with the glad tidings they said: "Verily, we are going to destroy the people of this [Lout's (Lot's)] town (i.e. the town of Sodom in Palestine) truly, its people have been Zalimun [wrong-doers, polytheists and disobedient to Allah, and have also belied their Messenger Lout (Lot)]."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when Our envoys brought Abraham the good news, they said, “We are going to destroy the people of this town; its people are wrongdoers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When Our emissaries brought the good news to Abraham, and said (to him): “We are surely going to destroy the inhabitants of this city; its inhabitants are immersed in wrong-doing.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when Our messengers came to Ibrahim with the glad tidings they said: "Verily, we are going to destroy the people of this town; truly, its people have been wrongdoers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Our messengers brought Abraham the good news, they said: Lo! we are about to destroy the people of that township, for its people are wrong-doers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good news, they said, ‘We are indeed going to destroy the people of this town. Its people are indeed wrongdoers.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Our Messengers brought Abraham the glad tidings they said: 'We are destroying the people of this village, because its people are harmdoers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, "Indeed, we will destroy the people of that Lot's city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Our angelic Messengers brought glad news to Abraham, they told him, "We are about to destroy the people of this town for their injustice".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Our apostles came to Ibrahim with the good news, they said: Surely we are going to destroy the people of this town, for its people are unjust.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When Our messengers brought Abraham the good news [of the birth of Isaac] they [also] said, "We are indeed going to destroy the people of this city, for the people of this city are truly wrongdoers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When Our Messengers came to Abraham with the good news, they said: "We are indeed going to destroy the people of this township: for truly they are (addicted to) crime."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "Surely Lot is there." They answered: "We know who is there. We are to save him and his family except his wife, for she is one of those who will stay behind."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Lot is in it.' They said, 'We know very well who is in it; assuredly We shall deliver him and his family, except his wife; she has become of those that tarry.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: verily Lut is therein. They said: we know better who is therein: we are to deliver him and his household, save his wife; she is to be of the lingerers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "But there is Lout (Lot) in it." They said:"We know better who is there, we will verily save him [Lout (Lot)] and his family, except his wife, she will be of those who remain behind (i.e. she will be destroyed along with those who will be destroyed from her folk)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Yet Lot is in it.” They said, “We are well aware of who is in it. We will save him, and his family, except for his wife, who will remain behind.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: “But Lot is there.” They replied: “We are well aware of those who are there. We shall save him and all his household except his wife.” His wife is among those who will stay behind.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Ibrahim said: "But there is Lut in it." They said: "We know better who is there. We will verily, save him and his family - except his wife, she will be of those who remain behind."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Lo! Lot is there. They said: We are best aware of who is there. We are to deliver him and his household, all save his wife, who is of those who stay behind.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Lot is in it.’ They said, ‘We know better those who are in it. We will surely deliver him and his family, except his wife: she shall be one of those who remain behind.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'Lot is in it' They replied: 'We know who are in it, we shall save him and his family, except his wife, she has become of those that shall remain behind'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Abraham] said, "Indeed, within it is Lot." They said, "We are more knowing of who is within it. We will surely save him and his family, except his wife. She is to be of those who remain behind."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham said, "Lot is there in that town!" They said, "We know everyone there. We shall certainly save him and his family except his wife who will remain behind."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Surely in it is Lut. They said: We know well who is in it; we shall certainly deliver him and his followers, except his wife; she shall be of those who remain behind.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham said, "But, Lot lives here." They answered, "We well know who lives here. We shall surely save him and his whole family, except his wife, who will be among those who stay behind."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "But there is Lut there." They said: "Well do we know who is there: we will certainly save him and his following,- except his wife: she is of those who lag behind!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob and gave his progeny prophethood and scripture, and rewarded him in this world, and in the next he will be among the upright.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and We appointed the Prophecy and the Book to be among his seed; We gave him his wage in this world, and in the world to come he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We bestowed on him Is-haq and Y'aqub, and We placed among his posterity prophethood and the Book, and We vouchsafed unto him his hire in the World, and verily in the Hereafter he shall be of the righteous.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We bestowed on him [Ibrahim (Abraham)], Ishaque (Isaac) and Ya'qub (Jacob), and ordained among his offspring Prophethood and the Book [i.e. the Taurat (Torah) (to Musa - Moses), the Injeel (Gospel) (to 'Iesa - Jesus), the Quran (to Muhammad SAW), all from the offspring of Ibrahim (Abraham)], and We granted him his reward in this world, and verily, in the Hereafter he is indeed among the righteous.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and conferred on his descendants the Prophethood and the Book, and gave him his reward in this life; and in the Hereafter he will be among the upright.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and We bestowed upon him (offspring like) Isaac and Jacob, and bestowed prophethood and the Book on his descendants and granted him his reward in this world; he will certainly be among the righteous in the Hereafter.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We bestowed on him, Ishaq and Ya`qub, and We ordained among his offspring prophethood and the Book, and We granted him his reward in this world; and verily, in the Hereafter he is indeed among the righteous.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and We established the prophethood and the Scripture among his seed, and We gave him his reward in the world, and lo! in the Hereafter he verily is among the righteous.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and We ordained among his descendants prophethood and the Book, and We gave him his reward in this world, and in the Hereafter he will indeed be among the Righteous.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And, We gave him (Abraham), Isaac and Jacob and appointed on his descendants the Prophethood and the Book. We gave him his wage in this world, and in the Everlasting Life he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We gave to Him Isaac and Jacob and placed in his descendants prophethood and scripture. And We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, he is in the Hereafter among the righteous.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We granted Isaac and Jacob to Abraham and We bestowed upon his offspring, prophethood and the Book. We gave him his reward in this world and in the next life, he will be among the pious ones.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We granted him Ishaq and Yaqoub, and caused the prophethood and the book to remain in his seed, and We gave him his reward in this world, and in the hereafter he will most surely be among the good.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave him Isaac and Jacob and granted prophethood and the Book to his descendants. We gave him his reward in this life and in the Hereafter he shall dwell among the righteous.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob and guided them, as We had guided Noah before them, and of his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus We reward those who are upright and do good.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave to him Isaac and Jacob -- each one We guided, And Noah We guided before; and of his seed David and Solomon, Job and Joseph, Moses and Aaron -- even so We recompense the good-doers --

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We bestowed upon him Is-haq and Ya'qub: each one We guided. And Nuh We had guided afore, and of his progeny Da-ud and Sulaiman and Ayyub and Yusuf and Musa and Harun. And thus We recompense the well-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We bestowed upon him Ishaque (Isaac) and Ya'qub (Jacob), each of them We guided, and before him, We guided Nuh (Noah), and among his progeny Dawud (David), Sulaiman (Solomon), Ayub (Job), Yusuf (Joseph), Musa (Moses), and Harun (Aaron). Thus do We reward the good-doers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob—each of them We guided. And We guided Noah previously; and from his descendants David, and Solomon, and Job, and Joseph, and Moses, and Aaron. Thus We reward the righteous.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We bestowed upon Abraham (offspring) Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya'qub (Jacob) and each of them did We guide to the right way as We had earlier guided Noah to the right way; and (of his descendants We guided) Da'ud (David) and Sulayman (Solomon), Ayyub (Job), Yusuf (Joseph), Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron). Thus do We reward those who do good.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We bestowed upon him Ishaq and Ya`qub, each of them We guided, and before him, We guided Nuh and among his progeny Dawud, Sulayman, Ayyub, Yusuf, Musa, and Harun. Thus do We reward the good-doers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob; each of them We guided; and Noah did We guide aforetime; and of his seed (We guided) David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the good.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob and guided each of them. And Noah We had guided before, and from his offspring, David and Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses and Aaron—thus do We reward the virtuous—

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave him Isaac and Jacob and guided both; and We guided Noah before them, among his descendants were David and Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses and Aaron as such, We recompense the gooddoers,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We gave to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - all [of them] We guided. And Noah, We guided before; and among his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob. Both had received Our guidance. Noah received Our guidance before Abraham and so did his descendants: David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron. Thus is the reward for the righteous people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We gave to him Ishaq and Yaqoub; each did We guide, and Nuh did We guide before, and of his descendants, Dawood and Sulaiman and Ayub and Yusuf and Musa and Haroun; and thus do We reward those who do good (to others).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave him Isaac and Jacob, each of whom We guided as We had guided Noah before. Among his descendants were David and Solomon, and Job, Joseph, Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the righteous.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah and Abraham, and gave prophethood to their progeny and the Book, and some of them are well-directed, but many of them are disobedient.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent Nooh and Ibrahim, and placed Prophethood and the Book among their descendants, so some among them took to guidance; and many of them are sinners.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We sent Noah, and Abraham, and We appointed the Prophecy and the Book to be among their seed; and some of them are guided, and many of them are ungodly.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Nuh and Ibrahim, and We placed in the posterity of the twain the prophecy and the Book. Then of them some are guided ones, and many of them are transgressors.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) and Ibrahim (Abraham), and placed in their offspring Prophethood and Scripture, and among them there is he who is guided, but many of them are Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and the Scripture. Some of them are guided, but many of them are sinners.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed We sent forth Noah and Abraham and established in their line Prophecy and the Book. Then some of them embraced the guidance and many of them are wicked.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed, We sent Nuh and Ibrahim, and placed in their offspring prophethood and Scripture. And among them there are some who are guided; but many of them are rebellious.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily sent Noah and Abraham and placed the prophethood and the scripture among their seed, and among them there is he who goeth right, but many of them are evil-livers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Noah and Abraham and We ordained among their descendants prophethood and the Book. Some of them are [rightly] guided, and many of them are transgressors.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent forth Noah and Abraham, and appointed the Prophethood and the Book to be given to their descendants. Some were guided, but many wereimpious.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Noah and Abraham and placed prophethood and the Book among their offsprings, some of whom have the right guidance. However, most of them are evil doers.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Nuh and Ibrahim and We gave to their offspring the (gift of) prophecy and the Book; so there are among them those who go aright, and most of them are transgressors.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent forth Noah and Abraham and bestowed upon their offspring prophethood and the Book. Some of them were rightly guided, but many others were transgressors.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and Revelation: and some of them were on right guidance. But many of them became rebellious transgressors.
